title: Use Monitoring, Logs, and Analytics Tools to Measure CDN And Site Performance
abstract: In this session, use metrics and logs from Amazon CloudFront, and tools such as Amazon CloudWatch and third-party performance measurement tools, to measure and improve your web and mobile performance.

title: [REPEAT] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.

title: [REPEAT] AWS Networking for Network Engineers
abstract: This is a hands-on and explorative session on what network engineers need to know about VPC mechanics and networking. We include hands-on exercises to demonstrate some differences in networking as well as the things that network engineers should know about AWS. Bring your laptops.

title: [REPEAT] Build a Migration Portfolio Assessment & Compare AWS & On-Premises Costs
abstract: Are you planning to move your data centers to AWS? In this session, we whiteboard how to build an accurate migration cost model and use AWS Application Discovery Service to obtain the information necessary to quickly build the model by incorporating Amazon EC2 pricing, target instance and storage sizes, network cost, and migration labor costs.

title: [REPEAT] Empower Lean Teams with Centrally Governed CI/CD Pipelines Using AWS CodePipeline & AWS Service Catalog
abstract: In this session, build a pipeline product that your lean teams can use to bring their application code, tests, and infrastructure to be vetted, executed, approved, and eventually published with AWS Service Catalog.

title: [REPEAT] Active Directory Domain Trusts and AWS SSO Jumpstart
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a domain trust between on-premises Active Directory and AWS Managed AD in AWS. As a bonus, learn how to connect AWS Managed AD to AWS SSO.

title: [REPEAT] Meet Cristine, Luke, Grace and Preston: Introduction to Sumerian Hosts (Virtual Avatars)
abstract: In this session, we introduce one of the most engaging features of the Amazon Sumerian service: Sumerian Hosts. Hosts are animated, interactive digital avatars that can be integrated into your 3D and augmented reality (AR) applications. Currently, there are four Hosts available: Cristine, Preston, Grace and Luke. In this builders session, we walk through the capabilities of Sumerian Hosts and demonstrate how to create custom speeches. After this builders session, you will be able to start creating dynamic scenes that include Hosts.

title: [REPEAT] Use Amazon MQ to Connect On-Premises Messaging to the Cloud
abstract: In this session, learn how to use Amazon MQ to connect IBM MQ to the AWS cloud. We demonstrate how to set up an Amazon MQ message broker and start sending messages from IBM MQ to Amazon MQ.

title: [REPEAT] Build on Amazon Aurora with MySQL Compatibility
abstract: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database with the speed, reliability, and availability of commercial databases at one-tenth the cost. Join this session, and get started with the MySQL-compatible edition, discuss your existing application running on Aurora, or learn about recently announced features, such as Serverless or Parallel Query.

title: [REPEAT] Stop Backing Up to Tape Now
abstract: Tapes. If they're still coming in and out of your data center, and you don't love dealing with them, join our AWS expert to learn how you can set up the AWS Storage Gateway service as a virtual tape library. You get the opportunity to deploy a tape gateway that works with your existing backup applications on-premises. Start your switch to cloud backups today without changing your workflows. Bring a laptop with remote access to your on-premises VM infrastructure, available memory and disk space for cache, and access to your existing backup application.

title: [REPEAT] Build a .NET CI/CD Pipeline with AWS & AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a .NET CI/CD pipeline with AWS and AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services.

title: [REPEAT] Migrate Your Oracle Database to Amazon RDS
abstract: If you're moving your Oracle databases to the cloud, Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) provides you with several options. Learn about Amazon RDS for Oracle, discuss the Oracle functionality that it supports, and see how to convert and migrate your database to Amazon Aurora for high performance and availability at one-tenth the cost.

title: [REPEAT] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.

title: [REPEAT] Building Multi-Region Microservices
abstract: In this session, participate in a hands-on exercise where you create, verify, and test a serverless solution across multiple regions using AWS Lambda and Amazon DynamoDB global tables.

title: [REPEAT] Migrate Your First SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS for SQL Server
abstract: With the approaching end of support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008, it is important to understand your options for upgrading the database layer of your existing applications. The fully managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for SQL Server makes it easy to upgrade, set up, operate, and scale your SQL Server business applications for high availability. Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to migrate a SQL Server database to Amazon RDS.

title: [REPEAT] Deploy and Scale a Multi-Tier Application with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: You're just getting started on your cloud journey. Perhaps you've deployed a simple application on AWS, but you're curious about how you can manage more complex workloads. In this session, we walk through some considerations to keep in mind when deploying multi-tier applications. We can even migrate one of your applications, or you can try it out on one of our demo apps.

title: Best Practices in Streaming Data with Amazon Kinesis
abstract: Amazon Kinesis makes it easy to collect, process, and analyze real-time, streaming data so you can get timely insights and react quickly to new information. In this builders session, we walk through a common use case for Amazon Kinesis Data Streams and the top five best practices we see customers implement when processing data in real-time.

title: [REPEAT] Learn How to Perform OTA Updates on Amazon FreeRTOS
abstract: Software patching is one of the most important defensive security techniques for connected devices, including for IoT. Feature upgrades are also a common business requirement for staying competitive. Amazon FreeRTOS supports over-the-air (OTA) updates using AWS IoT Device Management in the cloud and a portable interface on the device. Come see a demo and learn how to use Amazon FreeRTOS OTA with your product.

title: [REPEAT] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.

title: Set Up a Communications Platform on AWS with AI-Enhanced Services
abstract: Imagine being able to transcribe calls, translate them into multiple languages and then being able to identify key topics discussed in those calls. All of that is possible today with machine learning services offered by AWS. In AWS, you can easily integrate your real-time communication infrastructure with state-of-the-art AI services to enhance user experience. In this workshop, learn how to set up a secure and highly available WebRTC system on AWS and then integrate it with AWS AI services to provide services such as transcription (Amazon Transcribe), translation (Amazon Translate), and meta-data creation (Amazon Comprehend).

title: [REPEAT] Automatically Extract Metadata Using Computer Vision & Language AI Services
abstract: Customers are using automatic metadata extraction to fuel new insights and provide innovative services to their customers. In this session, we walk through the basic architecture patterns for implementing automatic metadata extraction using Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Transcribe, and Amazon Comprehend. We also share how to get started with the pre-configured AWS Media Analysis Solution.

title: [REPEAT] Amazon S3 Performance and Cost Optimization
abstract: Amazon S3 supports reporting and management tools designed to help users optimize their storage for performance and cost. In this builders session, customers learn how to create lifecycle policies to automatically move less-frequently accessed data to cheaper storage tiers. Amazon S3 experts walk through Amazon S3 inventory, object tagging, the Amazon S3 storage tiers, and Amazon S3 analytics storage class analysis, which observes object access patterns. Familiarity with Amazon S3 and the management console is recommended.

title: [REPEAT] Deploy Your Jenkins Pipeline to AWS & Optimize Your Builds
abstract: In this session, we help Jenkins users release on AWS quickly and easily. We install AWS CodeBuild to optimize your Jenkins builds and set up automatic deployments with AWS CodeDeploy.

title: [REPEAT] Move Your First Application to the Cloud with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: Have you ever wondered exactly how to get started with AWS? In this session, come spend time with the Amazon Lightsail team, and move one of your applications to the cloud. We sit down with you and help you deploy a workload on AWS using Lightsail. So bring your own workload, or use one of our demo examples, and get started today.

title: [REPEAT] Add Screen Support to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, you work with Echo Show to see how to add visual components to your conversational experiences.

title: [REPEAT] Automate Common Maintenance & Deployment Tasks Using AWS Systems Manager
abstract: AWS Systems Manager provides predefined automation documents for common operational tasks that can be customized to meet your specific use cases. In this session, learn how to build new or customize existing automation documents leveraging predefined documents, automation plugins, and environment variables. Use Systems Manager’s built-in rate controls to incrementally and safely roll out changes when stopping, starting, or restarting Amazon EC2 instances, updating Linux and Windows Amazon Machine Images, or updating software on multiple Amazon EC2 instances.

title: [BS] One Data Lake, Many Uses: Enable Multi-Tenant Analytics with Amazon EMR
abstract: One of the benefits of having a data lake is that the same data can be consumed by multi-tenant groups—an efficient way to share a persistent Amazon EMR cluster. The same business data can be safely used for many different analytics and data processing needs. In this builders session, we discuss steps to make an Amazon EMR cluster multi-tenant for analytics, best practices for a multi-tenant cluster, and solving common challenges. We also address security and governance aspects of a multi-tenant Amazon EMR cluster.

title: [REPEAT] Customizing the Environment in Your AR/VR Scene
abstract: An important aspect of developing immersive applications is the creation of a complete engaging environment. In this session, we show you how to modify the lighting, background, sky spheres, and sky boxes—settings for your scene that surround and establish the foundation for your immersive application.

title: [REPEAT] Upgrade AWS Direct Connect without Downtime
abstract: In this hands-on session, learn how to upgrade your AWS Direct Connect circuit without outages. We include details about failover, BGP settings, and how DX routing operates. Bring your laptop.

title: [REPEAT] Manage Long-Lived Transactions with AWS Step Functions
abstract: AWS Step Functions is a fully-managed serverless workflow-management service. Using visual workflows, you can easily manage long-running processes and coordinate the components of distributed applications and microservices. Join us to learn how you can use Step Functions to implement the Saga design pattern, which is particularly useful for dealing with the complexities of a long-lived transaction that spans across distributed components in a microservices architecture. You need your own laptop with administrator privileges, both the AWS CLI and AWS SAM CLI installed, and an active AWS account with power user access.

title: Engage the Crowd for Better Results from Amazon Mechanical Turk
abstract: Consistent feedback and communication, as well as the use of quality controls, can impact your ability to derive quality content from your workers at scale. Join us for best practices for engaging the crowd.

title: Application Integration of serverless apps
abstract: Use SQS, SNS, Lambda etc

title: [REPEAT] Amazon SageMaker and PyTorch: Tips & Tricks
abstract: In this session, learn how to use PyTorch in the Amazon SageMaker machine learning platform.

title: [REPEAT] Modernize Your Data Warehouse with Amazon Redshift
abstract: As organizations move from aggregating data from disparate sources to preparing the data for analytical workloads, they're constantly bottlenecked by the infrastructural limitations of their data warehousing infrastructure. Moving to a managed cloud data warehouse seems to be costly and risk-prone. This session takes you through an approach, personalized to your use case, for modernizing your data warehouse infrastructure powered by Amazon Redshift. It shows you how easy it is to migrate your setup to the cloud through AWS Database Migration Service, as well as how to migrate petabytes of data to the cloud quickly and securely with AWS Snowball, AWS Snowmobile, and other migration services.

title: [REPEAT] Plan, Track, and Execute Mass Migrations
abstract: Moving hundreds of applications and thousands of servers to AWS requires planning and automation. In this builders session, we whiteboard how to plan your application migrations, discuss the best migration strategies for your applications, and explore how automation and AWS Migration Hub, AWS Application Discovery Service, AWS Server Migration Service, and AWS Database Migration Service can super charge your migrations at scale.

title: [REPEAT] Build a Serverless .NET App on AWS Using the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to create and deploy a .NET serverless app on AWS using the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio.

title: [REPEAT] Build a Genome Clustering Model with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: The development and application of machine learning (ML) models is a vital part of scientific and technical computing. Increasing model training data size generally improves model prediction and performance, but deploying models at scale is a challenge. Participants in this builder session learn to use Amazon SageMaker, an AWS service that simplifies the ML process and enables training on cloud-stored datasets at any scale. Attendees walk through the process of building a model, training it, and applying it for prediction against large open scientific datasets, such as the 1000 Genomes data. By the end of the session, attendees have the resources and experience to start using Amazon SageMaker and related AWS services to accelerate their scientific research and time to discovery.

title: [REPEAT] Lifecycle Management of Amazon WorkSpaces Using the AWS Service Catalog Connector for ServiceNow
abstract: In this builder session, cloud architects, desktop managers, and ITSM leads learn how to use the AWS Service Catalog Connector to launch, operate, and manage Amazon WorkSpaces in ServiceNow. You also learn how to enable Amazon WorkSpaces user self-service capabilities, such as reboot and rebuild. You can use the capabilities and learn to build a governance and management framework for your Amazon WorkSpaces environment that incorporates self-service capabilities to reduce your management overhead.

title: [REPEAT] Writing Elasticsearch Queries for Search
abstract: The Elasticsearch query DSL is feature-rich, providing you with the ability to write queries that quickly isolate and expose the information that's most important to you. Whether you're searching log data or application data, you need to understand the capabilities and how to use them. Let's dig in together and build the queries and ranking that you want.

title: Getting Started with Streaming Video Using Amazon Kinesis Video Streams
abstract: In this builders session, we discuss how to capture, process, and analyze video streams using Amazon Kinesis Video Streams. We walk through a high-level, end-to-end architecture, and we discuss the first steps to start streaming video in real time.

title: [REPEAT] Building Multi-Region Persistence with MySQL
abstract: In this session, participate in a hands-on exercise where you create, verify, and test a relational solution across multiple regions using AWS Fargate and Amazon Aurora, MySQL-compatible with multi-region Multi-Master.

title: [REPEAT] How to Optimize TCO by Bringing Microsoft Licenses to AWS
abstract: Understanding the licensing options for Microsoft workloads on AWS is critical in achieving the lowest total cost of ownership (TCO) during a cloud migration. In this interactive session, we focus on best practices for bringing on-premises licenses to AWS, and we discuss how these choices impact TCO. Topics include license mobility, dedicated AWS infrastructure, development and testing, and the recently released Optimize CPU feature.

title: [REPEAT] Speed Alexa Skills Development with the ASK CLI
abstract: Build, manage, and deploy your Alexa skills programmatically from the command line using the ASK command line interface (CLI).

title: Automate IT Operations with Step Functions and CloudWatch Events
abstract: In this session, learn how to use AWS Step Functions to orchestrate serverless IT automation workflows in response to Amazon CloudWatch Events. These events are sourced from AWS Health, a service that monitors and generates events for your AWS resources. We also share a real-world example of automating the response to a scenario where an IAM user access key has been exposed.

title: [REPEAT 1] Add Screen Support to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, you work with Echo Show to see how to add visual components to your conversational experiences.

title: [REPEAT] Amazon SageMaker: Prebuilt Algorithms
abstract: In this session, learn how to use the range of built-in, high-performance machine learning algorithms that come with Amazon SageMaker.

title: Massively Parallel Data Processing at Scale
abstract: Get hands on with serverless data processing at scale. In this session, we use Landsat 8 satellite imagery to calculate a Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) across multiple points of interest in the world using the GeoTIFF data across multiple spectral bands.

title: Build a Streaming Application Using Amazon Kinesis
abstract: Amazon Kinesis Data Analytics enables you to quickly build and easily manage applications that process streaming data in real-time. In this builders session, we walk through the steps required to build a streaming application, including the most common issues and best practices.

title: [REPEAT] Microservices Insights with AWS X-Ray
abstract: In this session, learn how to easily debug and trace unhandled errors, performance bottlenecks, and customer impact in the distributed nature of a microservices architecture.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.

title: [REPEAT] Audit Your Device Fleet with AWS IoT Device Defender
abstract: AWS IoT Device Defender helps continuously audit security configurations for compliance with security best practices. Audits are performed for one or more sets of checks and can be configured to send notifications to SNS with findings. In this session, we walk through creating scheduled audits that run periodically as well as on-demand. We also walk through how to perform mitigation actions based on audit findings.

title: Demand Forecasting Using Deep Learning: A Hands-On Lab
abstract: Forecasting demand is essential for business owners and managers to make smarter, accurate, and profitable decisions. For example, the rising demand for fast food and increasing diversity of available options results in erratic demand for quick service restaurants. This solution helps analyze trends and plan for inventory availability, preventing food wastage and staff scheduling, thus resulting in increased savings. In this session, you get an overview of the automated deployment of the ML model, accompanied by hands-on experience with Amazon SageMaker. The solution implements deep learning models on Amazon SageMaker for faster training through parallelization and accurate results. Learn how to interpret model output and tweak the hyperparameters for iterative experiments, and plug in your own datasets for quick insights.

title: [REPEAT] Machine Learning Transcription: Tips & Tricks
abstract: Amazon Transcribe is an automatic speech recognition service that makes it easy for developers to add speech-to-text capability to their applications. Join us and learn how you can build machine transcription into your existing workflows, such as transcribing videos for search engines or captioning.

title: Creating a Support Chatbot
abstract: In this session, create a conversational interface with Amazon Lex which recognizes and answers common questions received through chat or voice. Become familiar with an Amazon Lex chatbot and its constructs, such as intents, utterances, and slots.

title: [REPEAT] Amazon Redshift Workload Management - Deep Dive
abstract: In this session, we walk you though the new features of Amazon Redshift workload management and the potential it offers to tune your cluster for the best query performance for your workloads. You'll be empowered with tools and tips to understand your current configuration and how to perform the needed optimizations. Walk away from the session with the confidence that your clusters are firing on all cylinders.

title: [REPEAT 1] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.

title: [REPEAT 1] Speed Alexa Skills Development with the ASK CLI
abstract: Build, manage, and deploy your Alexa skills programmatically from the command line using the ASK command line interface (CLI).

title: [REPEAT] Creating a Chatbot
abstract: In this hands-on training session, we show you how to create a chatbot using Sumerian Hosts integrated with Amazon Polly and Amazon Lex. Bringing voice and conversation transforms the way in which scenes are developed and how customers interact with an app. Learn how to create a chatbot using both verbal and typed inputs and responses.

title: [REPEAT] Design and Configure Advanced Routing Strategies for Amazon Connect
abstract: In this session, learn how to customize the routing in Amazon Connect for scenarios such as VIP customers, second tier and fallback support, and holiday or emergency handling. We guide you through building queues, routing profiles, and contact flows to solve for these advanced routing use cases. In the second half of this session, we explore how to solve for the specific routing use cases you may have.

title: [REPEAT] Deploy a Resilient and Cost-Effective App with EC2 Auto Scaling and CI/CD
abstract: Continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) with EC2 Auto Scaling can accelerate feature delivery, ensure the highest availability, and lower costs. In this session, we provide a hands-on experience in deploying your web app in an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group and setting up a CI/CD pipeline with AWS CodeDeploy and AWS CodePipeline. Learn best practices for setting up your EC2 Auto Scaling groups and scaling policies for a resilient infrastructure environment at the lowest cost.

title: [REPEAT 1] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.

title: Build a Serverless Web App: Wild Rydes
abstract: In this skills session, we walk through parts 1–3 of a five-part tutorial on how to build Wild Rydes, a unicorn ride-hailing web app. Learn how to configure Amazon S3 to host the static resource, create an Amazon Cognito user pool to manage your users’ accounts, and add dynamic functionality to your web-app using JavaScript to call remote RESTful APIs built with AWS Lambda and Amazon API Gateway.

title: Building and Deploying a Serverless API in Under an Hour
abstract: Are you looking for the fastest way to get started with serverless though a hands-on experience? This session is for you. Join us as we build an API using Python, AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and AWS X-Ray.

title: [REPEAT] Amazon SageMaker and TensorFlow: Tips & Tricks
abstract: In this session, learn how to use TensorFlow in the Amazon SageMaker machine learning platform.

title: [REPEAT 1] Use Amazon MQ to Connect On-Premises Messaging to the Cloud
abstract: In this session, learn how to use Amazon MQ to connect IBM MQ to the AWS cloud. We demonstrate how to set up an Amazon MQ message broker and start sending messages from IBM MQ to Amazon MQ.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build a Real-Time Kibana Dashboard for Your Contact Center Data
abstract: Learn how to build a real-time Kabana Contact Center dashboard leveraging services such as Amazon Kinesis, AWS Lambda, Amazon Athena, and ASW Glue. You will have a real-time view of your contact centre data to gain insights into areas such as the customer journey, KPI's, and monitoring your contact centre experience. We will also show how you can use other AI services such as Amazon Comprehend and Amazon Transcribe to get additional sentiment data about your agents and customers.

title: [REPEAT 2] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.

title: [REPEAT] AWS Systems Manager for Microsoft Workloads
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a management and patching strategy with AWS Systems Manager for on-premise and cloud resources.

title: Serverless Security Remediation
abstract: In this session, learn how to automatically remediate security issues using AWS Lambda, Amazon CloudWatch Events, and the AWS Personal Health Dashboard. In this session, we build AWS Lambda functions to react to an access key compromise to disable the keys and notify our operations team.

title: Learn to Perform Serverless Stream Processing
abstract: In this serverless IoT use case, you learn how to stream data from medical devices, transform and enrich the data to remove confidential patient information, and perform data analytics, all without having to manage infrastructure. You get hands-on experience with AWS IoT, AWS Lambda, Amazon Kinesis, and Amazon S3.

title: [REPEAT] Managing Application Costs and Performance Using AWS Auto Scaling
abstract: In this session, learn how AWS Auto Scaling enables you to configure scaling for all your application resources in as few as three steps.

title: [REPEAT 1] Migrate Your First SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS for SQL Server
abstract: With the approaching end of support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008, it is important to understand your options for upgrading the database layer of your existing applications. The fully managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for SQL Server makes it easy to upgrade, set up, operate, and scale your SQL Server business applications for high availability. Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to migrate a SQL Server database to Amazon RDS.

title: [REPEAT] Build Knowledge Graphs with Amazon Neptune
abstract: Knowledge graphs are a powerful way to relate information. In this session, learn how to build a knowledge graph with Amazon Neptune by using Metaphactory.

title: [BS] Metrics-Driven Performance Tuning for AWS Glue ETL Jobs
abstract: AWS Glue provides a horizontally scalable platform for running ETL jobs against a wide variety of data sources. In this builders session, we cover techniques for understanding and optimizing the performance of your jobs using Glue job metrics. Learn how to identify bottlenecks on the driver and executors, identify and fix data skew, tune the number of DPUs, and address common memory errors.

title: [REPEAT] Build a Searchable Image Library with Amazon Rekognition
abstract: Join us for a deep dive on building a searchable image library using Amazon Rekognition. We walk though creating a search index for objects and scenes so you can quickly retrieve images using labels created from automatic metadata extraction. Also learn how to use AWS Lambda to automatically maintain your image library.

title: [REPEAT] Manage Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling Groups via AWS CloudFormation & Launch Templates
abstract: In this session, we focus on launch templates and their usage through Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling and AWS CloudFormation. Launch templates are designed to be an interactive, hands-on environment for anything you want to build. Learn about managing your Auto Scaling groups using launch templates. Roll up your sleeves, get your laptop out, and ask us anything you want to about your project.

title: [REPEAT] Build on Amazon Aurora with PostgreSQL Compatibility
abstract: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database with the speed, reliability, and availability of commercial databases at one-tenth the cost. Join this session, and get started with the PostgreSQL-compatible edition, discuss your existing application running on Aurora, or learn about recently announced features, such as Fast Database Cloning or Performance Insights.

title: [REPEAT] Deploy Your Web App Safely with Blue-Green Deployments
abstract: In this session, learn about reducing your production downtime with blue-green deployments. Learn how to quickly build your deployment pipeline using AWS CodePipeline, and take a deep dive into AWS CodeDeploy.

title: [REPEAT] Optimizing Your Immersive Application: Tips & Tricks from the Experts
abstract: In this this session, we provide insights into advanced settings to increase the performance of your scene by optimizing the environment, adjusting settings, modifying asset size, etc. Come prepared to raise questions, discuss challenges, and create solutions with experienced Amazon Sumerian experts.

title: [REPEAT] Scale up a Web Application
abstract: In this session, you use an automated test suite to bombard an application with an increasing number of concurrent users. You then identify the bottlenecks and refactor the application. Discover how many concurrent users can you get to.

title: [REPEAT 2] Speed Alexa Skills Development with the ASK CLI
abstract: Build, manage, and deploy your Alexa skills programmatically from the command line using the ASK command line interface (CLI).

title: [REPEAT 2] Add Screen Support to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, you work with Echo Show to see how to add visual components to your conversational experiences.

title: [REPEAT] Build on Amazon RDS for Oracle
abstract: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) is a popular choice for moving new and legacy Oracle Database workloads to the cloud. Join us in this session to discuss your migration and licensing options, learn about recent Amazon RDS for Oracle features, and go deep on database performance and high availability.

title: [REPEAT] Amazon S3 Storage Management
abstract: Amazon S3 offers the most flexible management and administration capabilities to classify, report, and visualize your data usage trends so that you can make informed decisions to optimize performance and cost. Attend this builders session to learn how to use the following Amazon S3 management features: create and manage lifecycle policies, create and manage cross-region replication rules, configure storage class analysis, configure Amazon S3 inventory, and configure request metrics. Also learn how to use the latest Amazon S3 features in a controlled setting with members from our Amazon S3 team. Some knowledge of storage management and familiarity of the Amazon S3 console is recommended but not necessary.

title: [REPEAT] How to Use Cost Explorer and Budgets to Manage Your AWS Costs
abstract: Understanding, analyzing, controlling, and optimizing your AWS costs is easier than ever with our native AWS products. In this interactive session, we cover the basic and advanced capabilities of Cost Explorer, AWS Budgets, and their associated APIs. We also provide hands-on training for how to use these products effectively in real-world environments.

title: [REPEAT 2] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.

title: [REPEAT] Infrastructure Protection in AWS
abstract: AWS provides security capabilities and services to increase privacy and control network access. In this session you'll learn how to enable network firewalls through Amazon VPC and security groups in Amazon EC2, plus consider connectivity options that enable private connections from your office or on-premises environment.

title: [REPEAT] Learn to Safely Deploy OTA Updates with AWS IoT Device Management
abstract: Interested in knowing how you can safely deploy over-the-air (OTA) updates with AWS IoT Device Management? In this session, learn how AWS IoT Device Management allows you to push software and firmware to devices in the field to patch security vulnerabilities and improve device functionality.

title: [REPEAT] Using AWS CloudFormation to Manage Networking in AWS
abstract: In this session, learn how to deploy a complete networking environment on AWS using AWS CloudFormation. By the end of this session, you will be confident in managing your infrastructure as code. Bring your laptops.

title: [REPEAT] Set Up a Serverless CI/CD Pipeline with AWS CodeStar
abstract: In this session, you start your first serverless application using AWS CodeStar to set up a CI/CD. Then, we debug our AWS Lambda functions using AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) Local with AWS Cloud9. Finally, we learn about monitoring distributed applications with AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch.

title: [REPEAT] Entering VR: Create and Publish a Virtual Reality Scene with Sumerian
abstract: In this session, we walk you through the process of creating an immersive application that is then published and consumed via virtual reality (VR). The one-click publishing feature in Amazon Sumerian enables you to build once and then publish to an array of devices. Sumerian supports Oculus Rift, Oculus Go, HTC Vive, HTC Vive Pro, Lenovo Mirage Solo, and Google Daydream headsets, which run a compatible browser and enable the user to experience the scene in VR.

title: [REPEAT 1] Deploy and Scale a Multi-Tier Application with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: You're just getting started on your cloud journey. Perhaps you've deployed a simple application on AWS, but you're curious about how you can manage more complex workloads. In this session, we walk through some considerations to keep in mind when deploying multi-tier applications. We can even migrate one of your applications, or you can try it out on one of our demo apps.

title: [REPEAT] Cloud Data Migration with Amazon EBS
abstract: In this session, we focus on the fundamentals for beginning your SAN migration strategy to the cloud. Get hands-on experience setting up Amazon EBS volumes, and learn how to optimize your volumes for performance, availability, and durability.

title: [REPEAT] Perform Diagnostics on Running Instances without Affecting Availability/Reliability
abstract: In this Builder Session, we demonstrate how remove an instance from an auto-scaling group. We use AWS Service Catalog to provision a bastion, and then we use AWS Systems Manager to provision SSH access for a limited time to perform diagnostics. When we complete, access will be removed, and the bastion will be decommissioned. Attendees need an account that can provision AWS Lambda, Amazon EC2, AWS Service Catalog, AWS Systems Manager, and Amazon CloudWatch Events.

title: [REPEAT 1] Lifecycle Management of Amazon WorkSpaces Using the AWS Service Catalog Connector for ServiceNow
abstract: In this builder session, cloud architects, desktop managers, and ITSM leads learn how to use the AWS Service Catalog Connector to launch, operate, and manage Amazon WorkSpaces in ServiceNow. You also learn how to enable Amazon WorkSpaces user self-service capabilities, such as reboot and rebuild. You can use the capabilities and learn to build a governance and management framework for your Amazon WorkSpaces environment that incorporates self-service capabilities to reduce your management overhead.

title: [REPEAT] Create the Voices You Want with Amazon Polly
abstract: Many of today's text-to-speech systems limit your choices to a few voices. If these voices aren't right for your needs, the process of adding more voices is usually costly and time consuming. Learn how you can use Amazon Polly for speech production and to modify voices for a range of uses, from game development and telephony to web publishing.

title: Ingesting High-Volume, High-Speed Data Using Amazon Kinesis
abstract: Amazon Kinesis makes it easy to collect, process, and analyze real-time, streaming data so you can get timely insights and react quickly to new information. The first problem customers solve using Amazon Kinesis is how to get data into a stream. In this builders session, we walk you through the options of writing data to a stream and the pros and cons of each option.

title: [REPEAT 1] AWS Networking for Network Engineers
abstract: This is a hands-on and explorative session on what network engineers need to know about VPC mechanics and networking. We include hands-on exercises to demonstrate some differences in networking as well as the things that network engineers should know about AWS. Bring your laptops.

title: Full Stack Security in the Shared Responsibility Model
abstract: How can you achieve full stack security—including infrastructure, network, host, platform, application, and data—in the Shared Responsibility Model? In this session, Armor discusses how to address the requirements of the Shared Responsibility Model while augmenting native AWS security controls, like AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), Amazon GuardDuty, AWS CloudTrail, Amazon Inspector, and AWS WAF. Armor also discusses how to unify visibility across your environment to effectively monitor your cloud security posture, as well as the role of incident response in security. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Armor Defense Inc.

title: Accelerating IT Modernization: HCL’s Cloud Adoption Strategy
abstract: With the hyperscale cloud gaining momentum, HCL has innovated and differentiated the way to harness the power of cloud. HCL's cloud adoption framework is based on the Maintain–Sustain–Explore strategy, and it provides a holistic approach for customers to accelerate their cloud journey. We assess their needs and understand areas where cloud can add value. We then design a roadmap to migrate workloads and applications to cloud. Lastly, we implement the migration roadmap and manage the customer environment using automation and cognitive abilities at the core. In this session, we explain how we help customers define, refine, and redefine their cloud adoption journey. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, HCL America, Inc.

title: Architecting DevSecOps: Advanced Cyber Security for AWS
abstract: Cloud networks are vulnerable to a variety of cyberattacks. While cloud providers protect the cloud fabric and maintain the availability of cloud services, it is up to each customer to secure any and all data, workloads, or other assets they place in the cloud. Check Point CloudGuard delivers unprecedented protection against even the most sophisticated fifth-generation cyberattacks targeting cloud networks in a dynamic and elastic package specifically designed for AWS cloud environments. Join us to learn how organizations around the world are leveraging Check Point CloudGuard in AWS to achieve true DevSecOps at speed and scale. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Check Point Software Technologies.

title: Optimize Cloud Migration and Ops with AWS and ServiceNow
abstract: IT operations and DevOps teams can use ServiceNow and AWS to create new applications and migrate legacy applications to the AWS Cloud in order to meet the needs of their internal and external customers. AWS and ServiceNow have developed a range of connectors to manage the migration process to the AWS Cloud, improve operations with AWS CloudTrail and Amazon CloudWatch, and provide improved governance of AWS CloudFormation through the AWS Service Catalog connector with ServiceNow. Join this session to learn about how AWS and ServiceNow can help you reduce costs and increase the uptime of your AWS Cloud environment. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, ServiceNow.

title: Dynamic Connection Network You Need the Moment You Need It
abstract: The applications you’re developing today require flexible, dynamic network connectivity. Application usage, seasonal spikes, special events … all these situations can drive periodic spikes in your bandwith requirements. In this session, join CenturyLink experts for a demonstration of Cloud Connect and Dynamic Connections, and learn how to add network capacity dynamically to respond to the needs of your applications. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, CenturyLink.

title: [REPEAT 2] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.

title: [REPEAT 1] Deploy Your Web App Safely with Blue-Green Deployments
abstract: In this session, learn about reducing your production downtime with blue-green deployments. Learn how to quickly build your deployment pipeline using AWS CodePipeline, and take a deep dive into AWS CodeDeploy.

title: [REPEAT] ETL or ELT - Amazon Redshift Makes It Easy
abstract: If loading data into your data warehouse is a big pain point for you, come join us as we provide best practices to make your data pipeline more performant and reliable. Learn how to generate the schema for your semi-structured data, create ETL code to transform, flatten, and enrich your data, and load your data warehouse on a recurring basis.

title: [REPEAT 3] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.

title: [REPEAT] .NET on AWS: Problem Solving with AWS Software Engineers
abstract: Experts from the .NET SDK engineering team would love to help you brainstorm solutions to your problems. Come and chat with us for an hour.

title: [REPEAT] Which Database Should I Use?
abstract: Evaluating the best database to use for a job isn't as clear as it was ten years ago. Join us in this session to review your relational and nonrelational database options on AWS to ensure the best fit for your application. We also discuss related topics, such as managed database services, serverless databases, and heterogeneous migrations between different database types.

title: [REPEAT] Build Internet-Scale Apps with Amazon DynamoDB
abstract: Amazon DynamoDB is a non-relational database that delivers reliable performance at any scale. It's a fully managed, multi-region, multi-master database that provides consistent single-digit millisecond latency, and it offers built-in security, backup and restore, and in-memory caching. Come to this session to learn how to build internet-scale apps with DynamoDB.

title: Build a Serverless Twitter Bot
abstract: In this session, learn how to build a serverless Twitter bot with AWS Lambda and Python.

title: Delivering Fresh Data to Your Data Lake Using Amazon Kinesis
abstract: Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose is the easiest way to reliably load streaming data into data stores and analytics tools. In this builders session, we discuss how to use Kinesis Data Firehose to ingest, transform, and deliver data to Amazon S3 in a format that you can easily process.

title: [REPEAT 1] How to Optimize TCO by Bringing Microsoft Licenses to AWS
abstract: Understanding the licensing options for Microsoft workloads on AWS is critical in achieving the lowest total cost of ownership (TCO) during a cloud migration. In this interactive session, we focus on best practices for bringing on-premises licenses to AWS, and we discuss how these choices impact TCO. Topics include license mobility, dedicated AWS infrastructure, development and testing, and the recently released Optimize CPU feature.

title: [REPEAT 2] Migrate Your First SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS for SQL Server
abstract: With the approaching end of support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008, it is important to understand your options for upgrading the database layer of your existing applications. The fully managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for SQL Server makes it easy to upgrade, set up, operate, and scale your SQL Server business applications for high availability. Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to migrate a SQL Server database to Amazon RDS.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build on Amazon Aurora with MySQL Compatibility
abstract: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database with the speed, reliability, and availability of commercial databases at one-tenth the cost. Join this session, and get started with the MySQL-compatible edition, discuss your existing application running on Aurora, or learn about recently announced features, such as Serverless or Parallel Query.

title: [REPEAT] Set Up a Serverless App Using React and AWS Amplify
abstract: Through this demonstration, see how easy it is to build a fully functional and secure cloud-native application in hours rather than in days or weeks. This demo includes the use of AWS Cloud9, a cloud-based IDE, to build a fully serverless cloud native application in React using the AWS Mobile Hub via the AWS Mobile CLI and AWS Amplify.

title: Architecture Patterns of Serverless Stream Processing at Scale
abstract: Streaming application architectures are commonly used to solve real-time analytics requirements. Serverless architectures are a great fit for stream-processing applications because they enable you to lower operational costs, pay per execution, and they can seamlessly scale as your stream data rates vary. In this workshop, learn how to create serverless stream processing architectures that can seamlessly scale as your needs grow. Get hands-on experience using Amazon Kinesis Data Streams, Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose, Amazon Kinesis Data Analytics, and AWS Lambda to create real-time analytics pipelines. Learn how to ingest streaming data at scale and process it to generate insights in real-time..

title: [REPEAT] AWS DeepLens Projects: Tips & Tricks
abstract: In this session, get general help on how to build or extend a project with AWS DeepLens.

title: [REPEAT] Amazon SageMaker and Chainer: Tips & Tricks
abstract: In this session, learn how to use Chainer, an open-source deep learning framework written in Python, in the Amazon SageMaker machine learning platform.

title: Machine Learning in Telco: Analysis of Call Detail Record Data Sets
abstract: In this session, we show an end-to-end sample machine learning (ML) workflow on AWS with a sample analysis using a call detail record (CDR) data set. The model does not solve all customer problems, but provides a data science framework that can be adjusted to the customer's specific data set and analytic goals. We focus on a sample CDR data set, leveraging Jupyter Notebooks to support three main functions: ad-hoc data exploration and visualization using AWS Glue to transform raw data into Parquet format, using Amazon Athena to perform three sample data sampling analyses; data preparation and feature engineering, splitting data into test/training sets and developing data features (Jupyter Notebook); and model training and evaluation using logistic regression with Spark MLlib and evaluative tests (Jupyter Notebook).

title: [REPEAT 1] Design and Configure Advanced Routing Strategies for Amazon Connect
abstract: In this session, learn how to customize the routing in Amazon Connect for scenarios such as VIP customers, second tier and fallback support, and holiday or emergency handling. We guide you through building queues, routing profiles, and contact flows to solve for these advanced routing use cases. In the second half of this session, we explore how to solve for the specific routing use cases you may have.

title: [REPEAT] Build High-Performance Apps with Amazon ElastiCache
abstract: Amazon ElastiCache offers fully managed Redis and Memcached, which you can use to seamlessly deploy, run, and scale popular open-source compatible in-memory data stores. Come to this session to learn how to build data-intensive apps or improve the performance of your existing apps by retrieving data from high throughput and low latency in-memory data stores.

title: [REPEAT 3] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.

title: [REPEAT] Manage Your IoT Device Lifecycle with AWS IoT Device Management
abstract: In this session, learn how to manage your device lifecycle from start to finish with AWS IoT Device Management. By the end of this session, expect to understand how to onboard devices, organize device inventory, monitor a fleet of devices, and remotely manage and update devices deployed across many locations.

title: [REPEAT 3] Add Screen Support to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, you work with Echo Show to see how to add visual components to your conversational experiences.

title: [REPEAT] Detect Abnormal Device Behavior with AWS IoT Device Defender
abstract: AWS IoT Device Defender continuously monitors device behavior. You can define appropriate behaviors for your devices by selecting the right thresholds. In this session, we set up some thresholds and give you advice on best practices for how to select the right thresholds. AWS IoT Device Defender alerts you when behaviors are violated. We show you how to fine-tune the device behavior thresholds to match your use case.

title: Cloud Adoption for Digital Transformation: A Path to Success
abstract: Boosting innovation while effectively running your existing business can be derailed by excessive friction in processes, burdensome governance, and tools built to solve yesterday’s problems. In this session, you get key strategies for breaking through barriers to accelerate cloud adoption. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, BMC.

title: Realize Operational Efficiencies to Secure Cloud Environment
abstract: AWS provides great security and connectivity solutions for their customers. But managing your on-premises workloads separately from your AWS environment can often be challenging. Additionally, users connecting through hybrid environments usually have to go through multiple steps to get to the right resources. In this session, we explore the limitations of traditional network security, which can be compounded by the move to the cloud, and why it's time for a new approach. We explain the benefits of the Software-Defined Perimeter model: how it verifies and secures all user access to resources and strictly limits network access. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Cyxtera.

title: [REPEAT] Releasing Mission-Critical Software at Amazon
abstract: Come join us as we take a deeper look at Amazon's approach to releasing mission-critical software. In this session, we take a journey through the release process of an AWS Tier 1 service on its way to production. We follow a single code change from idea to release, and we focus on how Amazon updates critical software quickly and safely for its global customers. Throughout the talk, we demonstrate how our internal software release processes map to AWS developer tools, and we highlight how you can leverage AWS CI/CD services to create your own robust release process.

title: Building a CI/CD Pipeline for Containers on AWS
abstract: Containers can make it easier to scale applications in the cloud, but how do you set up your CI/CD workflow to automatically test and deploy code to containerized apps? In this session, we explore how developers can build effective CI/CD workflows to manage their containerized code deployments on AWS.

title: [REPEAT] Managing Modern Infrastructure in Enterprises
abstract: In this session, Verizon shares how it uses AWS Systems Manager for inventory, compliance, and patch management solutions. Learn about the challenges that large enterprises face when they attempt to retrofit legacy solutions for cloud environments, and discover best practices for using AWS Systems Manager for minimal access policies, custom Amazon Machine Images, tagging policies, encryption, and more.

title: Breaking Containers: Chaos Engineering for Modern Applications on AWS
abstract: You may have heard of the buzzwords “chaos engineering” and “containers.” But what do they have to do with each other? In this session, we introduce chaos engineering and share a live demo of how to practice chaos engineering principles on AWS. We walk through chaos engineering practices, tools, and success metrics you can use to inject failures in order to make your systems more reliable..

title: Leadership Session: Networking
abstract: Join Dave Brown, VP of EC2 Networking at AWS, to learn about the new services and features we launched this year. Dave also share our vision for the future of connectivity in the cloud and the ongoing evolution of networking capabilities. Dave covers the entire suite of networking services, including Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC), Elastic Load Balancing, AWS PrivateLink, VPN, and AWS Direct Connect. In addition, Dave reviews some real-world customer scenarios and how AWS networking solves those in a secure, reliable, flexible, and highly performant way.

title: Build End-To-End IT Lifecycle Management on AWS with ServiceNow
abstract: In this workshop, cloud architects, IT service management (ITSM) leads, and IT managers learn how to launch and operate governed cloud workloads on AWS by leveraging AWS management tools on the ServiceNow platform. Attendees have the option of managing the provisioning process for an Amazon Workspaces desktop or migrating a database leveraging the Amazon DMS through ServiceNow. This workshop simulates the launching of AWS services using the AWS Service Catalog Connector for ServiceNow and the operational activities established to demonstrate the ITSM process integration within ServiceNow (workflows, CMDB updates, incident management, change management).

title: Global Architecture: Bridge Serverless, Real-Time Apps with the Data Processing Ecosystem
abstract: Seamlessly bridge your application’s real-time operational surfaces—which face customers, devices, and latency-sensitive components—to its data processing inner surfaces—which enable BI, machine learning, and other massive analytical workloads. Learn how to compose Amazon Kinesis, Amazon Redshift, Amazon S3, AWS Lambda, and MongoDB into a flexible, secure, and performant architectural core. Then learn through concrete examples how that core extends in order to handle a wide range of applications, from rich financial accounting platforms to cloud-based, open IoT operating systems. This session is brought to you by AWS partner, MongoDB.

title: [REPEAT] Up and Running with Amazon Linux WorkSpaces
abstract: Amazon WorkSpaces provides cloud desktops based on Amazon Linux 2. This help developers and office workers boost their productivity while providing secure data and access. In this workshop, attendees learn how to set up Amazon Linux WorkSpaces at scale to help make developers more productive. Attendees configure and provision their own Amazon Linux WorkSpaces and join them to their existing directory and corporate network configurations. We also cover how to continuously manage, orchestrate, and apply usage policies to Amazon WorkSpaces for both Linux and Windows fleets using different administration and orchestration tools.

title: [REPEAT] Microsoft Active Directory Deep Dive
abstract: Want to learn about your options for running Microsoft Active Directory on AWS? When you move Microsoft workloads to AWS, it is important to consider how to deploy Microsoft Active Directory in support of group policy management, authentication, and authorization. In this session, we discuss options for deploying Microsoft Active Directory to AWS, including AWS Managed Microsoft AD and deploying Active Directory to Windows on Amazon EC2. We cover such topics as how to integrate your on-premises Microsoft Active Directory environment to the cloud and how to leverage SaaS applications, such as Office 365, with the AWS Single Sign-On service.

title: [REPEAT] Hands-On with Advanced AWS CloudFormation Techniques and New Features
abstract: You've written templates for AWS CloudFormation, and now it's time to move to the next level. In this workshop, we explore advanced AWS CloudFormation functionality to help you improve your authoring skills for complex templates. Learn how to use AWS CloudFormation mappings and constraints, StackSets, and two new recently released features to increase your infrastructure automation efficiency, while simultaneously addressing business requirements, such as configuration drift. A laptop is required for all participants.

title: Speed and Performance: How to Manage and Originate Live Video at Scale
abstract: When broadcasting major sporting events while ensuring reliability, performance is not just something expected from the athletes. In this session, customers share how they are using AWS Elemental MediaStore to solve challenges in their workflows and provide fans with dependable live video streams and Machine Learning (ML)-powered and enhanced data-driven video experiences. Learn how they layer MediaStore, ML, and other AWS services to build an architecture that scales for growing audiences, performance requirements, and levels of redundancy.

title: [REPEAT] Securing Serverless Applications and AWS Lambda
abstract: Serverless computing is a paradigm shift in software development, allowing for increased innovation and agility as well as cost savings. As a developer, how do you build enterprise-grade security measures into your serverless application to protect your data and meet compliance requirements? In this workshop, participants get hands-on experience applying security best practices to improve the security posture of a basic serverless application. We examine coding best practices for security as well as many of the security features and services provided by the AWS platform, such as IAM, resource policies, input validation, Private API Rndpoints, and Secrets Manager.

title: [REPEAT] End Extra Spending: Hunting for Increased Value through Cost Optimization
abstract: This is a a workshop that could pay for itself. It is aimed at both IT and finance teams. Increase the value realized with AWS by hunting for ways to cost optimize your environment. In this workshop, you learn core cost optimization functions, such as rightsizing, elasticity, and pricing models, so you can hunt for the greatest savings and reduce your costs by more than 50%.

title: Hands-On: Building a Migration Strategy for SQL Server on AWS
abstract: In this workshop, we discuss how to migrate SQL Server databases to AWS. Following a short presentation, attendees have the opportunity to choose a hands-on walkthrough to migrate a SQL Server database from an on-premises environment to SQL Server on Amazon EC2 or SQL Server on Amazon RDS. Bring a laptop for the hands-on exercises.

title: Meet Luke, Cristine, Grace and Preston - Sumerian Hosts
abstract: In this workshop, we introduce one of the most engaging features of the Amazon Sumerian service: Sumerian Hosts. Hosts are animated, interactive, digital avatars that can be integrated into your 3D and augmented reality applications. We currently have four Hosts available: Cristine, Preston, Grace and Luke. In this workshop, we walk through the capabilities of the Hosts and show you how to create custom speeches. After this workshop, participants will be able to start creating dynamic scenes that include Hosts.

title: [REPEAT] AWS IoT Core Workshop
abstract: Get hands on with the main components of AWS IoT Core. You will learn how to connect and manage your devices, secure device connections and data, process and act upon device data, and read and set device state at any time. You will see how the Device Gateway serves as the entry point for IoT devices connecting to AWS. The Device Gateway supports the MQTT, WebSockets, and HTTP 1.1 protocols. You will work with the high throughput Message Broker to securely transmit messages to and from all of your IoT devices and applications. The flexible nature of the Message Broker’s topic structure allows you to send messages to, or receive messages from, as many devices as you would like. It supports messaging patterns ranging from one-to-one command and control messaging, to one-to-one million (or more!) broadcast notification systems. You will set up the Registry to track device attributes and metadata and create a persistent, virtual version of each device known as the Device Shadow.  Finally, you will explore the Rules Engine to author rules within the management console or write rules using a SQL-like syntax. Join us if you are a cloud architect, device engineer, software developer, or firmware engineer.

title: SaaS Reference Architectures: Review of Real-World Patterns & Strategies
abstract: There is no single approach to building SaaS applications on AWS. Domain, compliance, performance, legacy considerations, and business forces all play a big role in shaping the architecture of your solutions. While there are many strategies for implementing SaaS on AWS, there are some common architectural patterns that are used to address the varying needs of SaaS providers. In this session, we review in detail a collection of SaaS reference architectures that represent a spectrum of approaches to addressing identity, onboarding, storage partitioning, tenant isolation, billing, deployment, regional distribution, and operational models. Our goal is to provide a menu of concrete solutions that can provide insights into how AWS constructs are leveraged to realize SaaS best practices on AWS.

title: [REPEAT] IoT Analytics Workshop
abstract: This workshop enables customers to work with the AWS IoT Analytics service. Participants learn to configure AWS IoT Analytics as well as ingest, explore, and visualize the data.

title: Workshop:Getting Started with Amazon VPC
abstract: In this introductory workshop, we focus on the basic principles behind building scalable, secure, performant VPC infrastructures for those who are new to AWS. We build on the breakout session, "Creating Your Virtual Data Center: VPC Fundamentals and Connectivity Options," and we give you the opportunity to get hands on and follow through on the implementation of this type of infrastructure. We recommend you bring your own laptop.

title: AWS for Manufacturing: Digital Transformation throughout the Value Chain
abstract: The digital transformation of the manufacturing industry is underway in all aspects of the value chain and the cloud is at the center . In this session, you will learn how global manufacturing companies are realizing the business value of AWS IoT, HPC, ML, data lakes, and other AWS services in design and engineering, manufacturing to service operations. Aerospace pioneer Airbus, will describe how their Skywise serverless platform uses AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, ElasticSearch and other services to provide airlines with predictive maintenance solutions for their fleets. Technology innovator Xilinx will show how they use HPC, Data Lake, and AI in the cloud for critical semiconductor workloads including large scale simulations and machine learning to improve product quality and yield, and speed time to market. Georgia-Pacific, a leading manufacturer of paper and fabric, will discuss their use of data lakes to identify operational efficiencies across their 300 global locations. Finally, global bearing manufacturer SKF will demonstrate how they use AWS IoT to connect smart products with smart factories, providing real-time insights to their global customers worldwide to optimize machine health and reduce costs.

title: Moving Large Scale Contact Centers to Amazon Connect
abstract: In this session, you will learn how Intuit and Hilton are migrating their large scale contact centers to Amazon Connect, a self-service, cloud-based contact center offering based on the same technology used by over 70,000 Amazon Customer Service Associates.  We will begin the session with an overview of Amazon Connect and hear from Intuit and Hilton about their experiences and best practices that will help prepare any large scale business planning a migration to Amazon Connect.

title: [REPEAT] Optimizing Costs as You Scale on AWS
abstract: The cloud offers a first-in-a-career opportunity to constantly optimize your costs as you grow and stay on the leading edge of innovation. By developing a cost-conscious culture and assigning the responsibility for efficiency to the appropriate business owners, you can deliver innovation efficiently and cost effectively. In this session, we review a wide range of cost planning, monitoring, and optimization strategies featuring real-world experience from AWS customers.

title: [REPEAT 2]  Enterprise Governance and Security: Build Your AWS Landing Zone
abstract: In this workshop, we present best practices for establishing an AWS Landing Zone. You get the opportunity to test the automated AWS Landing Zone solution to build a multi-account architecture. You set up and create an AWS environment that is enterprise-ready for application deployment and compliant with your operations, security, and procurement processes. You also learn how to modify the code for custom deployments. Leave this workshop with an understanding of the landing zone solution components and how they integrate to provide a secure, scalable starting environment for your cloud journey. We encourage you to attend the full AWS Landing Zone track, including SEC303. Search for #awslandingzone in the session catalog.

title: National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency: Changing the Way the Intelligence Community Moves Data
abstract: In this session, we feature the U.S. National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA), a key stakeholder and sponsor for the new AWS Secret Region, which supports workloads up to the Secret U.S. security classification level and is readily available to the U.S. Intelligence Community (IC). NGA uses AWS Snowball Edge to support War Fighter, utilizing imagery from NGA’s Open Data Store and implementing geospatial applications on the edge. AWS Snowball Edge allows NGA to directly support its mission, providing products and services to decision makers, warfighters, and first responders when they need it most. Enabling the edge changes NGA’s ability to share critical resources, data to facilitate user access meets NGA’s mission needs, and support the IC and Department of Defense as a whole

title: Leadership Session: Alexa for Business
abstract: Alexa transformed the smart home market segment and is now transforming how we interact with applications and technology at work. Alexa for Business is a service that helps you manage Alexa devices, users, and skills and helps you voice-enable your workplace. In this session, Collin Davis, GM, Alexa for Business, talks about the new features in Alexa for Business and how customers are adopting Alexa VUI in their workplace.

title: [REPEAT] Deep Dive on Amazon EC2 Instances & Performance Optimization Best Practices
abstract: Amazon EC2 provides a broad selection of instance types to accommodate a diverse mix of workloads. In this session, we provide an overview of the Amazon EC2 instance platform, key platform features, and the concept of instance generations. We dive into the current generation design choices of the different instance families, including the General Purpose, Compute Optimized, Storage Optimized, Memory Optimized, and GPU instance families. We also detail best practices and share performance tips for getting the most out of your Amazon EC2 instances.

title: Maximize AWS Investment to Drive Profitability and Sustainable Growth
abstract: In this session, we learn how mutual investment from AWS and AWS Partner Network (APN) Partners can drive sustainable growth and profitability in APN Partner organizations, and hear how successful AWS partnerships are developed.

title: [REPEAT] Building Serverless Applications with GraphQL and Graph Databases
abstract: In this session, learn how to build a data driven, serverless calorie tracker application with real-time, offline, and data syncing capabilities. The application provides an overview of your progress toward the calorie intake goal you've set, recommended intake remains, and breakdown of calories consumed. Use Amazon Cognito to build signup and sign-in capabilities as well as federated login to Facebook. The application integrates with AWS AppSync to provide real-time data from multiple data sources through GraphQL technology as well as offline capability. AppSync makes it easy to access this data and provide the exact information your application needs. As a bonus, learn to use Amazon Neptune, a fully managed graph database, to build a personalized recommendation engine for calorie intake.

title: Dynamic Encounters for Veteran Players Using Machine Learning
abstract: Are you trying to keep your game fresh for long-time players but don't have the resources to keep building new handcrafted content? Join this session to learn how to launch dynamic content for groups of players without relying on static techniques like instancing or spawn points. We dive into Amazon Kinesis and Amazon Kinesis Data Analytics for real-time data collection and hotspot detection, and machine learning for encounter-building based on observed player behavior.

title: Build a Babel Fish with Machine Learning Language Services
abstract: In the novel, “The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy,” Douglas Adams described a Babel fish as a “small, yellow, and leech-like” device that you stick in your ear. In Star Trek, it is known simply as the universal language translator. Whatever you call it, there is no doubting the practical value of a device that is capable of translating any language into another. In this workshop, learn how to build a babel fish app that recognizes voice and converts it to text (speech-to-text), translates the text to a language of your choice, and converts translated text to synthesized speech (text-to-speech).

title: [REPEAT] Instrumenting Kubernetes for Observability Using AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch
abstract: In this hands-on workshop, we walk you through instrumenting container workloads running on the Amazon Elastic Container Service for Kubernetes (Amazon EKS). Learn how Amazon CloudWatch and the new AWS X-Ray capabilities enable you to quickly understand problem areas in your application and determine customer impact. To participate in this workshop, bring your laptop and have a nonproduction AWS account.

title: How to Cost-Optimize Your Microsoft Workloads on AWS
abstract: In this session, we cover practical steps for cost-optimizing your Microsoft workloads on AWS from both a licensing and infrastructure perspective. We discuss ways to diversify and optimize your current licensing investments, how to think strategically about licensing in the cloud, and how to bring your own licenses to AWS. We also cover a variety of additional cost optimization features and approaches, and we explain how these can be applied to Microsoft-specific workloads.

title: [REPEAT] Build Your Own Alexa Voice Service Device Using a Raspberry Pi and AVS Device SDK
abstract: In this hands-on workshop, learn how to build voice-enabled devices with the Alexa Voice Service (AVS), Amazon’s intelligent voice-recognition and natural language understanding service. At the end of this session, expect to understand the process for bringing hands-free voice services to any connected device, how to build a robust C++ client using the AVS Device SDK, and how to test your AVS device. Leave this session with a working prototype of an Alexa-enabled device on a Raspberry Pi. Bring your laptop. You’ll be coding.

title: [REPEAT] Advanced Design Patterns for Amazon DynamoDB - Workshop
abstract: Join us for a practical hands-on workshop on using Amazon DynamoDB. This session is designed for developers, engineers, and database administrators who are involved in designing and maintaining DynamoDB applications. We begin with a walkthrough of proven NoSQL design patterns for at-scale applications. Next, we use step-by-step instructions to apply lessons learned to design DynamoDB tables and indexes that are optimized for performance and cost. Expect to leave this session with the knowledge to build and monitor DynamoDB applications that can grow to any size and scale. Attendees should have a basic understanding of DynamoDB. Bring your laptop to participate in this workshop.

title: Make Your Disaster Recovery Plan Resilient & Cost-Effective
abstract: Consolidating the data center continues to be imperative for most enterprises. There is a good chance that you've been asked to use the cloud as a disaster recovery (DR) solution and eliminate use of secondary on-premises sites. How should you think about this strategy? What are the key requirements you should consider? In this session, learn how Cohesity can help you build a bulletproof plan for disaster recovery on AWS. Hear how a joint customer is using the Cohesity DataPlatform on the AWS Cloud to meet audit requirements for DR and at the same time enable the archiving of backup data. This session is brought to you by AWS partner, Cohesity, Inc.

title: Scaling Push Messaging for Millions of Netflix Devices
abstract: Netflix built Zuul Push, a massively scalable push messaging service that handles millions of always-on, persistent connections to proactively push time-sensitive data, like personalized movie recommendations, from the AWS Cloud to devices. This has helped reduce Netflix’s notification latency and Amazon EC2 footprint by eliminating wasteful polling requests. It also powers Netflix’s integration with Amazon Alexa. Zuul push is a high performance async WebSocket/SSE server. In this session, we cover its design and how it delivers push notifications globally across AWS Regions.  Key takeaways include how to scale to large number of persistent connections, differences between operating this type of service versus traditional request/response style stateless services, and how push messaging can be used to add new, exciting features to your application.

title: [REPEAT] Security & Compliance for Modern Serverless Applications
abstract: Serverless architecture and a microservices approach has changed the way we develop applications. Increased composability doesn't have to mean decreased auditability or security. In this talk, we discuss the security model for applications based on AWS Lambda functions and Amazon API Gateway. Learn about the security and compliance that comes with Lambda right out of the box and with no extra charge or management. We also cover services like AWS Config, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), Amazon Cognito, and AWS Secrets Manager available on the platform to help manage application security.

title: Customizing Your Amazon Connect Contact Center
abstract: Hear from Amazon Connect customers on how they seamlessly integrated their business applications with Amazon Connect using a combination of development tools and available AWS services. axialHealthcare demonstrates their HIPAA-compliant phone platform, built around Amazon Connect, which enables its clinical care team to increase provider and patient outreach efficiency, enhance client reporting, and improve provider and patient satisfaction while ensuring the safety of protected health information. Rackspace shares how they used the Amazon Connect Streams API to build a customized agent experience through a native desktop application to accommodate diverse agent configurations and multiple platforms.

title: Running Serverless at The Edge
abstract: AWS Lambda enables you to run code without provisioning or managing servers in an AWS Region. Lambda@Edge provides the same benefits, but runs closer to your end users, enabling you to assemble and deliver content, on-demand, to create low-latency web experiences. Come and join us for examples of how customers can move significant workloads they previously managed with server fleets to truly serverless website backends. Sentient Technologies, an artificial intelligence technology company, will share how they use Lambda@Edge for solving various use cases such as leveraging AI to improve customer engagement and uplift website conversions, and many more.

title: Realize the Promise of Hybrid Cloud with Pure Storage
abstract: CIOs have realized that it’s not a question of cloud or on premises—both are critical weapons for their success. Technology and architecture must facilitate using on premises and public cloud together. But today, that can be a challenge, and nowhere is it more evident than at the data tier. Data is the “heart” of the application, and if you can’t easily bridge and move data between on premises and cloud, making applications portable between the two is nearly impossible. In this session, learn how you can unify on premises and cloud with Pure Storage, making it possible to truly run a hybrid cloud storage architecture. This session is brought to you by AWS partner, Pure Storage.

title: [REPEAT] Amazon Linux 2: A Stable, Secure, High-Performance Linux Environment
abstract: In this session, learn about Amazon Linux 2, the next generation Amazon Linux operating system that now comes with five years of support. See what’s new with Amazon Linux 2, how it's different from other distributions of Linux, and understand why it’s rapidly becoming the go-to operating system for AWS customers.

title: Authentication & Authorization in GraphQL with AWS AppSync
