abstract: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database with the speed, reliability, and availability of commercial databases at one-tenth the cost. Join this session, and get started with the PostgreSQL-compatible edition, discuss your existing application running on Aurora, or learn about recently announced features, such as Fast Database Cloning or Performance Insights.

title: [REPEAT 3] Migrate Your First SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS for SQL Server
abstract: With the approaching end of support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008, it is important to understand your options for upgrading the database layer of your existing applications. The fully managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for SQL Server makes it easy to upgrade, set up, operate, and scale your SQL Server business applications for high availability. Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to migrate a SQL Server database to Amazon RDS.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build a .NET CI/CD Pipeline with AWS & AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a .NET CI/CD pipeline with AWS and AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services.

title: [REPEAT 1] Stop Backing Up to Tape Now
abstract: Tapes. If they're still coming in and out of your data center, and you don't love dealing with them, join our AWS expert to learn how you can set up the AWS Storage Gateway service as a virtual tape library. You get the opportunity to deploy a tape gateway that works with your existing backup applications on-premises. Start your switch to cloud backups today without changing your workflows. Bring a laptop with remote access to your on-premises VM infrastructure, available memory and disk space for cache, and access to your existing backup application.

title: [REPEAT] Build a Serverless Media Analysis & Image Processing Solution
abstract: Use AWS Step Functions along with Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Transcribe, and Amazon Comprehend to build a serverless application that extracts meaningful data from audio, image, and video files.

title: [REPEAT 2] Use Amazon MQ to Connect On-Premises Messaging to the Cloud
abstract: In this session, learn how to use Amazon MQ to connect IBM MQ to the AWS cloud. We demonstrate how to set up an Amazon MQ message broker and start sending messages from IBM MQ to Amazon MQ.

title: [REPEAT 1] Learn How to Perform OTA Updates on Amazon FreeRTOS
abstract: Software patching is one of the most important defensive security techniques for connected devices, including for IoT. Feature upgrades are also a common business requirement for staying competitive. Amazon FreeRTOS supports over-the-air (OTA) updates using AWS IoT Device Management in the cloud and a portable interface on the device. Come see a demo and learn how to use Amazon FreeRTOS OTA with your product.

title: Enhance your Amazon AppStream 2.0 Environments: Branding, Automation, and More
abstract: Learn how to customize your application streaming environment, automate image, fleet and stack management, and scale while optimizing your utilization. To participate in this builder session, you must have an active AppStream 2.0 fleet. You can build one in our workshop, Build an Amazon AppStream 2.0 Environment to Deliver Desktop Applications to Any Computer.

title: [REPEAT] Deploy a SQL Server Failover Cluster on AWS
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to deploy a SQL Server Failover Cluster Instance on AWS.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build a Serverless .NET App on AWS Using the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to create and deploy a .NET serverless app on AWS using the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio.

title: [REPEAT 1] Managing Application Costs and Performance Using AWS Auto Scaling
abstract: In this session, learn how AWS Auto Scaling enables you to configure scaling for all your application resources in as few as three steps.

title: [REPEAT] The State Machine: Create Dynamic, Interactive AR, VR, & 3D Experiences
abstract: In this session, learn to use the state machine to bring behaviors and interactivity to objects within their scene. Together, we create an interactive 3D scene using primitive shapes and basic objects. Learn how to import assets, change their position within a scene, and creative interactive behaviors using the state machine.

title: [REPEAT] Building Automated Actions Using AWS Trusted Advisor Checks
abstract: By using AWS Trusted Advisor checks in conjunction with AWS Lambda, AWS Step Functions, and AWS Systems Manager, we build from scratch automation to reduce risk, improve security, and optimize performance.

title: [REPEAT 1] Move Your First Application to the Cloud with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: Ever wonder exactly how to get started with AWS? In this session, come spend time with the Amazon Lightsail team, and move one of your applications to the cloud. We sit down with you and help you deploy a workload on AWS using Amazon Lightsail. So bring your own workload or use one of our demo examples, and get started today.

title: [REPEAT 2] Deploy and Scale a Multi-Tier Application with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: You're just getting started on your cloud journey. Perhaps you've deployed a simple application on AWS, but you're curious about how you can manage more complex workloads. In this session, we walk through some considerations to keep in mind when deploying multi-tier applications. We can even migrate one of your applications, or you can try it out on one of our demo apps.

title: [REPEAT 3] Speed Alexa Skills Development with the ASK CLI
abstract: Build, manage, and deploy your Alexa skills programmatically from the command line using the ASK command line interface (CLI).

title: [REPEAT 4] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.

title: Continuous Deployment to Kubernetes Using AWS Services
abstract: In this session, we describe how to create a continuous deployment architecture for containerized applications. We use AWS CodeCommit, AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS Lambda to deploy containerized applications into a Kubernetes cluster. In this environment, developers can remain focused on developing code without worrying about how it will be deployed, and development managers can be satisfied that the latest changes are always deployed.

title: [REPEAT] Analyze Live Video Streams with Amazon Rekognition Video
abstract: In this session, learn how to use Amazon Rekognition Video with Amazon Kinesis to receive and process video streams. We walk through recognizing faces, giving access to Amazon Kinesis Data Streams, as well as starting and reading the streaming video analysis. Whether you are building a "Who's Who" app similar to the royal wedding, or you need to identify athletes in real time, it is simple to add intelligent video analysis to your live streams using Amazon Rekognition.

title: Serverless Analytics with Amazon QuickSight
abstract: Querying and analyzing big data can be complicated and expensive. It requires you to set up and manage databases, data warehouses, and business intelligence (BI) applications—all of which require time, effort, and resources. Using Amazon Athena and Amazon QuickSight, you can avoid the cost and complexity by creating a fast, scalable, and serverless cloud analytics solution without the need to invest in databases, data warehouses, complex ETL solutions, and BI applications. In this builders session, we demonstrate how you can build a serverless big data analytics solution using Amazon Athena and Amazon QuickSight.

title: [REPEAT] Encryption in Transit Approaches for AWS Direct Connect
abstract: In this session, learn how to build a VPN overlay on AWS Direct Connect such that all traffic over the connection is encrypted. Bring your laptop.

title: [REPEAT] Build a Query to Analyze Data in Your Amazon Redshift Warehouse & S3 Data Lake Together
abstract: Not all of your data is always loaded into your data warehouse, and yet sometimes anaysts need access to it quickly, without waiting on an ETL job to load it. This sessions takes a hands-on approach to show you how to mine your Amazon S3 data lake using open data formats with Amazon Redshift Spectrum, a feature of Amazon Redshift, without the need for unnecessary data movement. This enables you to analyze data across your data warehouse and data lake together, with a single service.

title: [REPEAT] Building Your First Serverless Data Lake
abstract: In this session, you have the opportunity to learn the fundamental building blocks of a data lake on AWS. You design and build a serverless pipeline to ingest, process, optimize and query data in your very own data lake. We discuss different optimizations and best practices to tune your architecture for future growth.

title: [REPEAT] Identify & Address Query Performance Issues in Aurora
abstract: In this session, we discuss and demonstrate techniques and tools for identifying expensive queries as well as strategies for improving performance. The intended audience is developers, DBAs, and DBEs who are using Amazon Aurora or considering it.

title: [REPEAT 1] Active Directory Domain Trusts and AWS SSO Jumpstart
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a domain trust between on-premises Active Directory and AWS Managed AD in AWS. As a bonus, learn how to connect AWS Managed AD to AWS SSO.

title: [REPEAT 3] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.

title: [REPEAT 4] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.

title: [REPEAT 1] Audit Your Device Fleet with AWS IoT Device Defender
abstract: AWS IoT Device Defender helps continuously audit security configurations for compliance with security best practices. Audits are performed for one or more sets of checks and can be configured to send notifications to SNS with findings. In this session, we walk through creating scheduled audits that run periodically as well as on-demand. We also walk through how to perform mitigation actions based on audit findings.

title: [REPEAT 5] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.

title: [REPEAT] What Shall I Wear Today? Modifying the Appearance of Your Sumerian Host
abstract: In this session, learn about the different ways you can customize the appearance of your Sumerian Host. We developed these customizations based on customer feedback. Discover how you can choose among four outfits for your Host, the color of those outfits, as well as your own specific logo. See how the different ways to configure the Host's appearance enables you to create a virtual avatar that is authentic to the experience you want to create and to your brand.

title: [REPEAT] Machine Learning in the Edge - Enhanced by Amazon Sumerian
abstract: In this session, learn how to integrate AWS IoT services, AWS Greengrass, Amazon Machine Learning, and Amazon Sumerian. We demonstrate real-time inference analysis of photographs for object recognition, and we hold a discussion on applying these capabilities to other use cases and industries.

title: [REPEAT] Deploy a SQL Server Multi-Region Always On Availability Group Cluster
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to deploy a multi-region SQL Server Always-On Cluster.

title: [REPEAT 1] Scale up a Web Application
abstract: In this session, you use an automated test suite to bombard an application with an increasing number of concurrent users. You then identify the bottlenecks and refactor the application. Find out how many concurrent users can you get to.

title: [REPEAT 1] Learn to Safely Deploy OTA Updates with AWS IoT Device Management
abstract: Interested in knowing how you can safely deploy over-the-air (OTA) updates with AWS IoT Device Management? In this session, learn how AWS IoT Device Management allows you to push software and firmware to devices in the field to patch security vulnerabilities and improve device functionality.

title: [REPEAT 1] Automatically Extract Metadata Using Computer Vision & Language AI Services
abstract: Customers are using automatic metadata extraction to fuel new insights and provide innovative services to their customers. In this session, we walk through the basic architecture patterns for implementing automatic metadata extraction using Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Transcribe, and Amazon Comprehend. We also share how to get started with the pre-configured AWS Media Analysis Solution.

title: [REPEAT 4] Add Screen Support to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, you work with Echo Show to see how to add visual components to your conversational experiences.

title: [REPEAT 1] Detect Abnormal Device Behavior with AWS IoT Device Defender
abstract: AWS IoT Device Defender continuously monitors device behavior. You can define appropriate behaviors for your devices by selecting the right thresholds. In this session, we set up some thresholds and give you advice on best practices for how to select the right thresholds. AWS IoT Device Defender alerts you when behaviors are violated. We show you how to fine-tune the device behavior thresholds to match your use case.

title: [REPEAT 1] .NET on AWS: Problem Solving with AWS Software Engineers
abstract: Experts from the .NET SDK engineering team would love to help you brainstorm solutions to your problems. Come and chat with us for an hour.

title: [REPEAT 1] Perform Diagnostics on Running Instances without Affecting Availability/Reliability
abstract: In this Builder Session, we demonstrate how remove an instance from an auto-scaling group. We use AWS Service Catalog to provision a bastion, and then we use AWS Systems Manager to provision SSH access for a limited time to perform diagnostics. When we complete, access will be removed, and the bastion will be decommissioned. Attendees need an account that can provision AWS Lambda, Amazon EC2, AWS Service Catalog, AWS Systems Manager, and Amazon CloudWatch Events.

title: [REPEAT 1] Set Up a Serverless CI/CD Pipeline with AWS CodeStar
abstract: In this session, you start your first serverless application using AWS CodeStar to set up a CI/CD. Then, we debug our AWS Lambda functions using AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) Local with AWS Cloud9. Finally, we learn about monitoring distributed applications with AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch.

title: Build an IOT Application with IoT-Scale Telecom Infrastructure on the Cloud
abstract: Come learn how Soracom built an IoT-scale telecom-grade mobile packet core on AWS, enabling a vast ecosystem of applications that can use SIM-based IoT devices that integrate with AWS IoT. This session highlights the architectural best practices, telecom-partner integrations, and tips that make IoT deployments and management easier. You get the chance to work on interesting devices and build a live IoT sensor application.

title: [REPEAT 1] Which Database Should I Use?
abstract: Evaluating the best database to use for a job isn't as clear as it was ten years ago. Join us in this session to review your relational and nonrelational database options on AWS to ensure the best fit for your application. We also discuss related topics, such as managed database services, serverless databases, and heterogeneous migrations between different database types.

title: [REPEAT] Building High-Scale Web Apps on Amazon EC2 Fleet
abstract: In this builders session, get hands-on experience deploying a web app via Amazon EC2 Fleet on Spot Instances and On-Demand. Amazon EC2 Spot Instances offer spare compute capacity in the AWS Cloud available at steep discounts compared to On-Demand prices. Learn how to deploy a fleet of instances behind a load balancer and scale it to handle peak demand with Spot Instances, all while saving up to 90% on your compute costs.

title: [REPEAT] Working with Metadata in AWS Glue Data Catalog & Amazon Athena
abstract: Schema on read, enabled by the separation of metadata and compute, is a powerful feature of Amazon Athena. In this session, we dive deeper into how to better utilize this concept, properly plan for schema evolution, design efficient partitioning scheme, and apply other tips and tricks for working with metadata.

title: Build a Heavily Trafficked Web App
abstract: What if you could build a web application that supports true web-scale traffic without having to ever provision or manage a single server? Sounds magical, and it is! In this session, learn how to build a serverless website that automatically scales using services such as AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and Amazon S3. We review frameworks that can help you build serverless applications, such as the AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM). Leave this session with the tools and skills to build your first serverless web application.

title: [REPEAT] Shared Services VPCs: VPC Peering & AWS PrivateLink Designs
abstract: This is a hands-on session where you are guided on how to create a shared services VPC. Shared services VPCs often contain resources like authentication, security services, logging, and more. We provide examples of how to share these services over both AWS PrivateLink and VPC peering. Bring your laptops.

title: [REPEAT] Create an Augmented Reality Application with Amazon Sumerian
abstract: Sumerian's browser-based authoring tool reduces the complexity of creating an augmented reality (AR) application. In this session, participants learn how to use Sumerian in conjunction with ARKit and ARCore to create an augmented reality application that can be published to compatible iOS and Android smartphones.

title: [REPEAT 4] Speed Alexa Skills Development with the ASK CLI
abstract: Build, manage, and deploy your Alexa skills programmatically from the command line using the ASK command line interface (CLI).

title: Serverless Real-Time Data Processing
abstract: In this session, learn how you can use Amazon Kinesis and AWS Lambda to tackle various real-time processing needs. We share helpful hints on how to configure your stream and Lambda function and how to monitor your processing. We also discuss use cases on the types of processing you can do.

title: [REPEAT 2] Build a Real-Time Kibana Dashboard for Your Contact Center Data
abstract: Learn how to build a real-time Kibana contact centre dashboard, leveraging services such as Amazon Kinesis, AWS Lambda, Amazon Athena, and ASW Glue. You get a real-time view of your contact centre data to gain insights into areas such as the customer journey, KPIs and monitoring your contact centre experience. We also show you how to use other AI services, such as Amazon Comprehend and Amazon Transcribe, to get additional sentiment data about your agents and customers.

title: [REPEAT] Amazon SageMaker: Bring Your Own Framework
abstract: In this session, learn how to use your own framework in a Docker container within the Amazon SageMaker platform.

title: [REPEAT 5] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.

title: [REPEAT 1] Machine Learning Transcription: Tips & Tricks
abstract: Amazon Transcribe is an automatic speech recognition service that makes it easy for developers to add speech-to-text capability to their applications. Join us and learn how you can build machine transcription into your existing workflows, such as transcribing videos for search engines or captioning.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build Internet-Scale Apps with Amazon DynamoDB
abstract: Amazon DynamoDB is a non-relational database that delivers reliable performance at any scale. It's a fully managed, multi-region, multi-master database that provides consistent single-digit millisecond latency, and it offers built-in security, backup and restore, and in-memory caching. Come to this session to learn how to build internet-scale apps with DynamoDB.

title: [REPEAT 1] Amazon Redshift Workload Management - Deep Dive
abstract: In this session, we walk you though the new features of Amazon Redshift workload management and the potential it offers to tune your cluster for the best query performance for your workloads. You'll be empowered with tools and tips to understand your current configuration and how to perform the needed optimizations. Walk away from the session with the confidence that your clusters are firing on all cylinders.

title: [REPEAT 1] AWS Systems Manager for Microsoft Workloads
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a management and patching strategy with AWS Systems Manager for on-premise and cloud resources.

title: [REPEAT 4] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.

title: [REPEAT] Building & Architecting ML Workstreams for Topic Modeling
abstract: Decoupling and optimizing machine learning (ML) workstreams is top of mind for all AWS customers. In this session, we use Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Comprehend to build and architect a streamlined ML workstream that shows how to extract keywords and topic modeling from text. We train models and cluster articles, and we find insights and relationships between the data and correlate it to provide business value. We also explore the workstream integration with Amazon S3 and AWS Glue. We discuss different approaches, best practices, and building blocks of an ML environment. This session enables ML developers and architects to create decoupled ML workstreams for any text data, such as news feeds, case management, and journals.

title: [REPEAT] Modernize Your First Windows Application with Windows Containers
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to modernize a sample .NET application to run inside a Windows container from start to finish in 60 minutes.

title: [REPEAT 1] Customizing the Environment in Your AR/VR Scene
abstract: An important aspect of developing immersive applications is the creation of a complete engaging environment. In this session, we show you how to modify the lighting, background, sky spheres, and sky boxes—settings for your scene that surround and establish the foundation for your immersive application.

title: AWS Tools for PowerShell
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to explore several PowerShell use cases on AWS.

title: [REPEAT 6] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.

title: [REPEAT 2] How to Optimize TCO by Bringing Microsoft Licenses to AWS
abstract: Understanding the licensing options for Microsoft workloads on AWS is critical in achieving the lowest total cost of ownership (TCO) during a cloud migration. In this interactive session, we focus on best practices for bringing on-premises licenses to AWS, and we discuss how these choices impact TCO. Topics include license mobility, dedicated AWS infrastructure, development and testing, and the recently released Optimize CPU feature.

title: [REPEAT] Developing Best Practices for Machine Translation
abstract: Faced with higher volumes of content that require translation and with shorter completion times, more organizations are weighing the pros and cons of machine translation (MT) as a viable solution to tackle time-critical projects. Learn how you can adapt MT for your translation workflows using best practices, such as caching for cost savings, custom glossary for improved quality, and combining human and machine translation to achieve the best results.

title: Building Your Notifications Workflow with AWS Step Functions
abstract: Sending notifications to people through the many different channels they use can be daunting, whether it is for paging purposes or for a purely contextual notification. In this session, we use AWS Step Functions to create a notifications workflow and Amazon API Gateway to create a simpler API to notify people, be it on email, SMS, or Slack.

title: [REPEAT 1] Entering VR: Create and Publish a Virtual Reality Scene with Sumerian
abstract: In this session, we walk you through the process of creating an immersive application that is then published and consumed via virtual reality (VR). The one-click publishing feature in Amazon Sumerian enables you to build once and then publish to an array of devices. Sumerian supports Oculus Rift, Oculus Go, HTC Vive, HTC Vive Pro, Lenovo Mirage Solo, and Google Daydream headsets, which run a compatible browser and enable the user to experience the scene in VR.

title: [REPEAT 5] Add Screen Support to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, you work with Echo Show to see how to add visual components to your conversational experiences.

title: Serverless Photo Recognition System
abstract: Imagine that you work for a marketing agency that has tens of thousands of stock images. You find that many images don’t have descriptive file names and others are completely mislabeled. You don’t want to spend hours and hours relabeling them and moving them around to different folders. But what if you could find the images you need without relying on metadata? In this session, we deploy an end-to-end solution to show you how to do this using Amazon Rekognition and AWS Lambda.

title: [REPEAT 1] How to Use Cost Explorer and Budgets to Manage Your AWS Costs
abstract: Understanding, analyzing, controlling, and optimizing your AWS costs is easier than ever with our native AWS products. In this interactive session, we cover the basic and advanced capabilities of Cost Explorer, AWS Budgets, and their associated APIs. We also provide hands-on training for how to use these products effectively in real-world environments.

title: [REPEAT 1] Building Automated Actions Using AWS Trusted Advisor Checks
abstract: By using AWS Trusted Advisor checks in conjunction with AWS Lambda, AWS Step Functions, and AWS Systems Manager, we build from scratch automation to reduce risk, improve security, and optimize performance.

title: [REPEAT 2] Build on Amazon Aurora with MySQL Compatibility
abstract: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database with the speed, reliability, and availability of commercial databases at one-tenth the cost. Join this session, and get started with the MySQL-compatible edition, discuss your existing application running on Aurora, or learn about recently announced features, such as Serverless or Parallel Query.

title: [REPEAT 1] Building Multi-Region Microservices
abstract: In this session, participate in a hands-on exercise where you create, verify, and test a serverless solution across multiple regions using AWS Lambda and Amazon DynamoDB global tables.

title: [REPEAT] Empower Lean Teams with Centrally Crafted CI/CD Pipelines Using AWS CodePipeline & AWS CloudFormation
abstract: In this one-hour session, you build a pipeline product that your lean teams can use to bring their application code, tests, and infrastructure to be vetted, executed, approved, and eventually published with AWS CloudFormation.

title: [REPEAT 2] Managing Application Costs and Performance Using AWS Auto Scaling
abstract: In this session, learn how AWS Auto Scaling enables you to configure scaling for all your application resources in as few as three steps.

title: [REPEAT] Sizing Amazon Elasticsearch Service for Your Workload
abstract: Amazon Elasticsearch Service (Amazon ES) provides you with a great deal of flexibility in selecting the instance type and count for your data and master instances. In this session, we talk over your workload, the choices you can make, and how to optimize your Amazon ES deployment for cost and latency.

title: [REPEAT 1] Migrate Your Oracle Database to Amazon RDS
abstract: If you're moving your Oracle databases to the cloud, Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) provides you with several options. Learn about Amazon RDS for Oracle, discuss the Oracle functionality that it supports, and see how to convert and migrate your database to Amazon Aurora for high performance and availability at one-tenth the cost.

title: [REPEAT 1]  Automate Common Maintenance & Deployment Tasks Using AWS Systems Manager
abstract: AWS Systems Manager provides predefined automation documents for common operational tasks that can be customized to meet your specific use cases. In this session, learn how to build new or customize existing automation documents leveraging predefined documents, automation plugins, and environment variables. Use Systems Manager’s built-in rate controls to incrementally and safely roll out changes when stopping, starting, or restarting Amazon EC2 instances, updating Linux and Windows Amazon Machine Images, or updating software on multiple Amazon EC2 instances.

title: [REPEAT] Build Custom Models for AWS DeepLens with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: In this session, you will learn how to build and deploy computer vision models using the AWS DeepLens deep-learning-enabled video camera and Amazon SageMaker.

title: [REPEAT] Amazon Linux WorkSpaces for Developers
abstract: In this session, we discuss how developers can use Amazon Linux WorkSpaces to spend less time worrying about their development desktop and more time worrying about their code. We share best practices for setting up Amazon Linux WorkSpaces and explain how to manage them using different administration and orchestration tools.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build a Genome Clustering Model with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: The development and application of machine learning (ML) models is a vital part of scientific and technical computing. Increasing model training data size generally improves model prediction and performance, but deploying models at scale is a challenge. Participants in this builder session learn to use Amazon SageMaker, an AWS service that simplifies the ML process and enables training on cloud-stored datasets at any scale. Attendees walk through the process of building a model, training it, and applying it for prediction against large open scientific datasets, such as the 1000 Genomes data. By the end of the session, attendees have the resources and experience to start using Amazon SageMaker and related AWS services to accelerate their scientific research and time to discovery.

title: [REPEAT 1] Creating a Chatbot
abstract: In this hands-on training session, we show you how to create a chatbot using Sumerian Hosts integrated with Amazon Polly and Amazon Lex. Bringing voice and conversation transforms the way in which scenes are developed and how customers interact with an app. Learn how to create a chatbot using both verbal and typed inputs and responses.

title: [REPEAT 5] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.

title: [REPEAT 3] Deploy and Scale a Multi-Tier Application with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: You're just getting started on your cloud journey. Perhaps you've deployed a simple application on AWS, but you're curious about how you can manage more complex workloads. In this session, we walk through some considerations to keep in mind when deploying multi-tier applications. We can even migrate one of your applications, or you can try it out on one of our demo apps.

title: [REPEAT] Optimize Your SAP HANA Workloads with Amazon EC2 High Memory Instances
abstract: In this builders session, get hands-on experience in successfully deploying SAP HANA workloads on Amazon EC2 high-memory instances with up to 12 TiB of memory.  An AWS expert guides you through the planning, installation, and deployment of SAP workloads.  Amazon EC2 high-memory instances are certified by SAP for running Business Suite on HANA (SoH), the next-generation Business Suite S/4HANA, Data Mart Solutions on HANA, Business Warehouse on HANA (BW), and SAP BW/4HANA in production environments.

title: [REPEAT] Architecture Patterns for Natural Language Solutions: Tips & Tricks
abstract: Amazon brings natural language processing, automatic speech recognition, text-to-speech, and neural machine translation technologies within reach of every developer. Come to this session and learn how to build smarter applications or automate workflows with AWS language services.

title: [REPEAT 2] Deploy Your Web App Safely with Blue-Green Deployments
abstract: In this session, learn about reducing your production downtime with blue-green deployments. Learn how to quickly build your deployment pipeline using AWS CodePipeline, and take a deep dive into AWS CodeDeploy.

title: [BS] Building Advanced Workflows with AWS Glue
abstract: AWS Glue makes it easy to incorporate data from a variety of sources into your data lake on Amazon S3. In this builders session, we demonstrate building complex workflows using AWS Glue orchestration capabilities. Learn about different types of AWS Glue triggers to create workflows for scheduled as well as event-driven processing. We start with a customer scenario and build it step by step using AWS Glue capabilities.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build Knowledge Graphs with Amazon Neptune
abstract: Knowledge graphs are a powerful way to relate information. In this session, learn how to build a knowledge graph with Amazon Neptune by using Metaphactory.

title: [REPEAT 6] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.

title: [REPEAT] Overlapping IP Addresses: How to Tackle VPC Peering
abstract: In this session, we connect two VPCs with overlapping IP addresses by building two solutions. These solutions use AWS PrivateLink, VPN, and NAT. We then analyze the design tradeoffs of each approach. Bring your laptops.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build a Serverless Media Analysis & Image Processing Solution
abstract: Use AWS Step Functions along with Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Transcribe, and Amazon Comprehend to build a serverless application that extracts meaningful data from audio, image, and video files.

title: [REPEAT 1] Deploy a Resilient and Cost-Effective App with EC2 Auto Scaling and CI/CD
abstract: Continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) with Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling can accelerate feature delivery, ensure the highest availability, and lower costs. In this session, we provide a hands-on experience in deploying your web app in an EC2 Auto Scaling group and setting up a CI/CD pipeline with AWS CodeDeploy and AWS CodePipeline. Learn best practices for setting up your EC2 Auto Scaling groups and scaling policies for a resilient infrastructure environment at the lowest cost.

title: [REPEAT 5] Speed Alexa Skills Development with the ASK CLI
abstract: Build, manage, and deploy your Alexa skills programmatically from the command line using the ASK command line interface (CLI).

title: [REPEAT 2] Which Database Should I Use?
abstract: Evaluating the best database to use for a job isn't as clear as it was ten years ago. Join us in this session to review your relational and nonrelational database options on AWS to ensure the best fit for your application. We also discuss related topics, such as managed database services, serverless databases, and heterogeneous migrations between different database types.

title: [REPEAT 1] Infrastructure Protection in AWS
abstract: AWS provides security capabilities and services to increase privacy and control network access. In this session you'll learn how to enable network firewalls through Amazon VPC and security groups in Amazon EC2, plus consider connectivity options that enable private connections from your office or on-premises environment.

title: [REPEAT 2] Lifecycle Management of Amazon WorkSpaces Using the AWS Service Catalog Connector for ServiceNow
abstract: In this builder session, cloud architects, desktop managers, and ITSM leads learn how to use the AWS Service Catalog Connector to launch, operate, and manage Amazon WorkSpaces in ServiceNow. You also learn how to enable Amazon WorkSpaces user self-service capabilities, such as reboot and rebuild. You can use the capabilities and learn to build a governance and management framework for your Amazon WorkSpaces environment that incorporates self-service capabilities to reduce your management overhead.

title: [REPEAT] Increase Your Data Engineering Productivity: Use Jupyter Notebooks with Amazon EMR
abstract: Adoption of Jupyter Notebooks gives big data customers an easy way to leverage the open source Apache Spark in Amazon EMR for data science, interactive analytics, and to prototype jobs before bringing them to production. In this builders session, we show you how to make Amazon EMR an even simpler to use platform for developers and data engineers, increasing their productivity as they collaborate on different workloads and different clusters.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build on Amazon RDS for Oracle
abstract: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) is a popular choice for moving new and legacy Oracle Database workloads to the cloud. Join us in this session to discuss your migration and licensing options, learn about recent Amazon RDS for Oracle features, and go deep on database performance and high availability.

title: [REPEAT] Amazon SageMaker: Custom Algorithms
abstract: In this session, learn how to integrate custom algorithms into the Amazon SageMaker platform.

title: [REPEAT 2] Active Directory Domain Trusts and AWS SSO Jumpstart
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a domain trust between on-premises Active Directory and AWS Managed AD in AWS. As a bonus, learn how to connect AWS Managed AD to AWS SSO.

title: [REPEAT] Best Practices for Working with Large-Scale Geospatial Imagery
abstract: Across the commercial and public sectors, companies are working with large geospatial datasets. In this session, we review how to use various services, including Amazon S3, Amazon Glacier, Amazon Athena, AWS Batch, and AWS Step Functions to store, process, and get insights into your large geospatial datasets.

title: [REPEAT 1] Securing Your Amazon Elasticsearch Service Domain
abstract: Amazon Elasticsearch Service (Amazon ES) provides security at several different layers. Let's talk about how you can integrate with Amazon Cognito to provide single sign-on for Kibana, how to deploy into your VPC, and how to get data into Amazon ES domains in VPC. We also talk about how to write your IAM policies to scope your users' interaction with the service.

title: [REPEAT 2] Move Your First Application to the Cloud with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: Ever wonder exactly how to get started with AWS? In this session, come spend time with the Amazon Lightsail team, and move one of your applications to the cloud. We sit down with you and help you deploy a workload on AWS using Amazon Lightsail. So bring your own workload or use one of our demo examples, and get started today.

title: [REPEAT 1] Deploy a SQL Server Failover Cluster on AWS
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to deploy a SQL Server Failover Cluster Instance on AWS.

title: [REPEAT] Migrate Your SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS
abstract: If you're moving your SQL Server databases to the cloud, Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) provides you with several options. Join this session to learn about Amazon RDS for SQL Server, discuss the functionality that it supports, and see how to convert and migrate your database to Amazon Aurora for high performance and availability at one-tenth the cost.

title: [REPEAT 6] Speed Alexa Skills Development with the ASK CLI
abstract: Build, manage, and deploy your Alexa skills programmatically from the command line using the ASK command line interface (CLI).

title: [REPEAT 1] Shared Services VPCs: VPC Peering & AWS PrivateLink Designs
abstract: This is a hands-on session where you are guided on how to create a shared services VPC. Shared services VPCs often contain resources like authentication, security services, logging, and more. We provide examples of how to share these services over both AWS PrivateLink and VPC peering. Bring your laptops.

title: [REPEAT 2] Build a .NET CI/CD Pipeline with AWS & AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a .NET CI/CD pipeline with AWS and AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services.

title: Monitor in Real Time a Live Video Channel Combined from Media Services
abstract: In this session, we show how to monitor an over-the-top (OTT) video channel built with AWS Media Services. Users group media services into logical video channels to visualize channel connections and real-time alarms.

title: [REPEAT 2] Building & Architecting ML Workstreams for Topic Modeling
abstract: Decoupling and optimizing machine learning (ML) workstreams is top of mind for all AWS customers. In this session, we use Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Comprehend to build and architect a streamlined ML workstream that shows how to extract keywords and topic modeling from text. We train models and cluster articles, and we find insights and relationships between the data and correlate it to provide business value. We also explore the workstream integration with Amazon S3 and AWS Glue. We discuss different approaches, best practices, and building blocks of an ML environment. This session enables ML developers and architects to create decoupled ML workstreams for any text data, such as news feeds, case management, and journals.

title: [REPEAT] Migrate Your Non-Relational Database to AWS
abstract: In this session, learn how to migrate your non-relational database, such as Cassandra or MongoDB, to Amazon DynamoDB. We review how AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) and AWS Schema Conversion Tool (AWS SCT) can help you migrate quickly and securely, and we show you how DynamoDB implements the functionality of your source database.

title: [REPEAT] Create Your First AR/VR Scene in 60 Minutes
abstract: This hands-on session, we provide an orientation to the Amazon Sumerian console, IDE, scene templates, and asset library. By the end of this session, all participants will know how to set up an account, establish a scene template, and develop their first scene.

title: [REPEAT 1] Using AWS CloudFormation to Manage Networking in AWS
abstract: In this session, learn how to deploy a complete networking environment on AWS using AWS CloudFormation. By the end of this session, you will be confident in managing your infrastructure as code. Bring your laptops.

title: [REPEAT 1] AWS DeepLens Projects: Tips & Tricks
abstract: In this session, get general help on how to build or extend a project with AWS DeepLens.

title: [REPEAT 1] Optimizing Your Immersive Application: Tips & Tricks from the Experts
abstract: In this this session, we provide insights into advanced settings to increase the performance of your scene by optimizing the environment, adjusting settings, modifying asset size, etc. Come prepared to raise questions, discuss challenges, and create solutions with experienced Amazon Sumerian experts.

title: [REPEAT 6] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.

title: [REPEAT 7] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.

title: [REPEAT 3] How to Optimize TCO by Bringing Microsoft Licenses to AWS
abstract: Understanding the licensing options for Microsoft workloads on AWS is critical in achieving the lowest total cost of ownership (TCO) during a cloud migration. In this interactive session, we focus on best practices for bringing on-premises licenses to AWS, and we discuss how these choices impact TCO. Topics include license mobility, dedicated AWS infrastructure, development and testing, and the recently released Optimize CPU feature.

title: [REPEAT 2] Build a Serverless .NET App on AWS Using the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to create and deploy a .NET serverless app on AWS using the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio.

title: [REPEAT] Use Auto Scaling, Spot Pricing, and More Expert Strategies
abstract: Amazon EMR is a powerful service, enabling you to process and analyze big data at any scale. In this builders session, we share proven strategies to maximize your utilization while minimizing your costs for long-running clusters. We cover how to get the most leverage from features like Auto Scaling and Spot pricing. We also discuss how changing your design architecture by decoupling compute and storage impacts TCO. Not least, we show you how appropriately sizing instances, clusters, and jobs helps you save.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build a Migration Portfolio Assessment & Compare AWS & On-Premises Costs
abstract: Are you planning to move your data centers to AWS? In this session, we whiteboard how to build an accurate migration cost model and use AWS Application Discovery Service to obtain the information necessary to quickly build the model by incorporating Amazon EC2 pricing, target instance and storage sizes, network cost, and migration labor costs.

title: [REPEAT] Using Kibana with Amazon Elasticsearch Service
abstract: Once your data is in Amazon Elasticsearch Service, you need to understand Kibana, how it works, and what you can do with it. In this session we answer your questions and guide you on building the visualizations you want.

title: [REPEAT 4] Migrate Your First SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS for SQL Server
abstract: With the approaching end of support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008, it is important to understand your options for upgrading the database layer of your existing applications. The fully managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for SQL Server makes it easy to upgrade, set up, operate, and scale your SQL Server business applications for high availability. Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to migrate a SQL Server database to Amazon RDS.

title: [REPEAT 7] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.

title: [REPEAT] Amazon SageMaker and Apache MXNet: Tips & Tricks
abstract: In this session, learn how to use Apache MXNet in the Amazon SageMaker machine learning platform.

title: [REPEAT 3] Managing Application Costs and Performance Using AWS Auto Scaling
abstract: In this session, learn how AWS Auto Scaling enables you to configure scaling for all your application resources in as few as three steps.

title: [REPEAT] Build, Deploy, and Serve Machine Learning Models on Streaming Data
abstract: As data grows exponentially in organizations, there is an increasing need to use machine learning (ML) to gather insights from this data at scale and use those insights for real-time predictions on incoming data. This workshop walks you through the following: 1) training a Spark Model using Amazon SageMaker pointed to Apache Livy running on an Amazon EMR Spark cluster, 2) hosting the Spark model on Amazon SageMaker to serve a RESTful inference API, 3) and using the RESTful API to serve real-time predictions on streaming data from Amazon Kinesis Data Streams.

title: [REPEAT 1] Building Multi-Region Persistence with MySQL
abstract: In this session, participate in a hands-on exercise where you create, verify, and test a relational solution across multiple regions using AWS Fargate and Amazon Aurora, MySQL-compatible with multi-region Multi-Master.

title: Build an Event Registration Kiosk Powered by Facial Recognition
abstract: Registering for an event and waiting in line to verify your ticket in order to enter is a difficult process. Machine learning provides a solution to this challenge by using facial recognition to streamline the event registration process. This minimizes lines and enables attendees to quickly register and enter an event. In this session, we share best practices for building an event registration kiosk powered by facial recognition, integrating it with third-party registration services, and creating a web-based kiosk application.

title: How Jupiter Intel Uses AWS to Forecast Weather Impact & Climate Risk
abstract: Jupiter is a cloud-native company that delivers hyperlocal environmental information in a changing climate, primarily using AWS Batch. Through AWS Batch’s capability to execute thousands of scientific modeling jobs while managing scale and cost, Jupiter scientists can focus on data analysis and developing sophisticated machine learning (ML)-based applications to support private sector and local municipality customers; AWS Batch takes care of the rest. In this chalk talk, we demonstrate how AWS Batch, through managing resource provisioning and scheduling, enables flexibility across changing requirements to allow various modeling applications to run quickly and at scale.

title: Automating Backup and Archiving on AWS with Commvault
abstract: Are you planning to utilize just one data management platform to move, manage, and use data across on-premises and AWS Cloud environments? Commvault, an AWS Partner Network (APN) Advanced and Storage Competency Technology Partner, offers comprehensive data management for managing data across files, applications, databases, hypervisors, and clouds. In this chalk talk, we dive deep on how Commvault enables you to migrate onsite backup data onto Amazon S3 to reduce your hardware footprint and improve recoverability; implement data tiering and archive data in Amazon Glacier for long-term retention and compliance; and perform snapshot-based protection and recovery for applications running on Amazon EC2.

title: Training Users on Desktop Apps? Deliver Workshops to Any Customer with AppStream 2.0
abstract: In this chalk talk, we discuss delivering application workshops to a browser on any computer. Amazon AppStream 2.0 is a fully managed application streaming service that lets you stop managing unique software installations on different computers for each workshop. We walk through common AppStream 2.0 approaches for application delivery, user management, networking, billing, storage, and scaling.

title: Running Your SQL Server Database on Amazon RDS
abstract: In this session, learn how to run SQL Server on Amazon RDS, best practices for migration from on-premises or Amazon EC2 into Amazon RDS, and the pros and cons of running in Amazon RDS for SQL Server today. We also discuss workarounds for customer needs that are not supported today with Amazon RDS.

title: [REPEAT 1] Solve Common Voice UI Challenges with Advanced Dialog Management Techniques
abstract: This talk covers how skill developers can leverage ASK dialog management features to create fluid, natural conversations. We review common challenges with complex multi-turn dialogs, and we discuss how to leverage dialog management features to delight your customers. Learn how dialog features can be applied to contextually tune interpretation of a conversation and simplify backend code.

title: [REPEAT] Best Practices for AWS IoT Core
abstract: There are many different components of AWS IoT Core, including Device gateway, Registry, Message broker, Rules engine, and Device shadow. In this session, we cover each component in depth, how to use them, and best practices. Come away with an understanding of how AWS IoT Core can help you securely connect and manage devices, process and act on device data, and read and set device state. In addition to best practices, we discuss common customer questions when using different features of AWS IoT Core.

title: [REPEAT 1] Iterating Towards a Cloud-Enabled IT Organization
abstract: Transforming your organization and its people to become cloud-natives can be an overwhelming task. Platform teams, operations teams, development teams, and their even their leaders have non-technical challenges to consider and overcome to unlock the maximum value of running their businesses on AWS. In this chalk talk you’ll learn how to combine Amazonian ways of working, organizing, and enabling to kickstart your cloud journey with a “Cloud Foundation Team” and a small number of “Two-Pizza Application Teams”, and also how to then iteratively scale the concepts used to build these initial teams into a fully cloud-enabled IT organization.

title: Optimize Amazon EC2 Instance, AWS Fargate Container, & Lambda Function
abstract: AWS offers a wide selection of compute platforms. In this session, we highlight key platform features of different Amazon EC2 instance families, and provide a framework in which to choose the best compute resource (including Amazon EC2 Instance, AWS Fargate Container, and AWS Lambda function) for your workloads based on metrics and workload profiles. We also share best practices and performance tips for getting the most out of your Amazon EC2 instances to help you reduce unnecessary spending and improve application performance.

title: [REPEAT] Ask Me Anything about Amazon Aurora
abstract: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database with the speed, reliability, and availability of commercial databases at one-tenth the cost. We recently introduced several new features, such as Serverless, Multi-Master, Parallel Query, Backtrack, and Performance Insights. Bring your questions about these features or any other Aurora topic.

title: [CT] Metrics-Driven Performance Tuning for AWS Glue ETL Jobs
abstract: AWS Glue provides a horizontally scalable platform for running ETL jobs against a wide variety of data sources. In this builder's session, we cover techniques for understanding and optimizing the performance of your jobs using AWS Glue job metrics. Learn how to identify bottlenecks on the driver and executors, identify and fix data skew, tune the number of DPUs, and address common memory errors.

title: [REPEAT 2] How Avatars & AR Are Driving Innovation: Lessons from Life Support Medical
abstract: Life Support Medical has embraced the use of augmented reality, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and virtual avatars to transform how it provides health and aging services. In this session, learn how the company translated 20 years of research and clinical experience into an innovative new product line, Addison Care, built on AWS services. We provide an overview of the architecture and facilitate a discussion on selecting and integrating various services. Come prepared for a lively session.

title: [REPEAT] SaaS Jumpstart: A Primer for Launching Your SaaS Journey
abstract: Adopting a SaaS model is no trivial effort. Wandering into the universe of multi-tenancy means tackling a broad range of new architectural challenges. How do you automate the onboarding and provisioning of new tenants? How do you secure a shared multi-tenant infrastructure and prevent any flavor of cross-tenant access? How do you effectively partition tenant data? These are amongst a core set SaaS architecture topics in this chalk which is aimed at equipping SaaS newcomers with a clear view of some of the best practices associated with delivering SaaS solutions on AWS. The goal here is to explore and discuss fundamental architectural strategies of SaaS and highlight key considerations that will shape the security, agility, and success of your SaaS applications.

title: Building Your Geospatial Data Lake
abstract: In this chalk talk, we discuss how to design a data lake, and how to permission different groups and applications to access and analyze datasets. Learn from subject-matter experts about a variety of AWS technologies for populating your data lake, monitoring new ingestion, and processing data for meaningful analysis. We examine considerations for structured data, such as relevant database engines with geospatial support, as well as considerations for unstructured data in the form of object storage. In addition, we address how to protect and secure data based on an organization’s needs.

title: [REPEAT] Building Serverless Machine Learning Workflows
abstract: Modern machine learning workflows leverage AWS services, such as Amazon Transcribe and Amazon Comprehend, to extract, validate, mutate, and enrich your data. Some might drive transactional systems that use machine learning to generate metadata for media assets, while others might derive insights by visualizing customer interaction sentiment from call logs. They all share a common challenge: orchestrating a combination of distinct sequential and parallel steps that are fulfilled by independent microservices. Join us as we examine how workflows can be used to manage that orchestration in a way that is scalable, reliable, and easy to maintain and run. We contrast two approaches for creating such workflows: a traditional monolithic approach and a serverless approach utilizing AWS Steps Functions.

title: Optimize Your SQL Server Licenses on Amazon Web Services
abstract: Before you migrate your SQL Server workloads to AWS, you should have a clear understanding of SQL Server licensing and how to employ cloud licensing best practices for optimized TCO. In this session, we discuss licensing and support options and explore ways to optimize your database usage. AWS recently introduced new instance types and configurations that support your ability to optimize the cost of running SQL Server on AWS. We discuss how these innovations can enable your cloud strategy and help you get the most out of your licenses.

title: Amazon EMR: Optimize Transient Clusters for Data Processing & ETL
abstract: Amazon EMR was built for agility, enabling you to spin up and down resources for big data processing and analytics on demand, and realize the flexible potential of cloud. In this chalk talk, we discuss in detail how to efficiently start, stop, and resize your clusters for Apache Spark and Hadoop, reducing your costs, and accelerating your time to completion (TTC) for jobs. Join us to hear expert advice on how to optimize your "one-and-done" workloads.

title: Unsupervised Learning with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: How do you use machine learning with data that isn't labeled? The unsupervised learning capabilities of Amazon SageMaker can easily handle unstructured data. In this chalk talk, we discuss the intricacies of unsupervised algorithms that are built into Amazon SageMaker, including clustering with k-means and anomaly detection with Random Cut Forest.

title: [REPEAT] Serverless Anti-Patterns to Avoid
abstract: With cloud computing ushering in an era of agility and scalability, it’s also served as a catalyst, helping computing evolve from the physical and virtual servers of on premises to more flexible paradigms, including containers and more recently, serverless computing. Built on the same programming languages and tools used for traditional application architectures, serverless allows organizations to leverage their existing development skills, but like all new approaches, it also brings challenges. While traditional design approaches still apply to serverless, it’s easy to fall prey to serverless anti-patterns, including tight coupling, anemic monitoring, and monolithic coding. In this session, ex explore common serverless anti-patterns, and how to avoid them or right-design them with AWS Lambda and other related services.

title: [REPEAT] Achieving Business Value with AWS
abstract: The business case for cloud computing goes beyond total cost of ownership (TCO). In this chalk talk, you learn about the AWS Cloud Value Framework (CVF). This framework quantifies not only TCO savings, but also the value of business agility, operational resilience, and staff productivity, which you can use in building a case for change. After this session, you should be able to describe the benefits of the cloud to different stakeholders across your organization and present a comprehensive business case.

title: [REPEAT] Building Modern Platforms: A Practical Way to Migrate Legacy Systems to Amazon SQS
abstract: Learn how Comcast addressed their data quality and system resiliency issues by using AWS technologies such as Amazon SQS, Amazon SNS, Amazon DynamoDB, Elasticsearch, and Logstash to replace a legacy messaging system. The new messaging system, Publish Subscribe Platform (PSP), interconnects customer management, billing, and provisioning applications. It is becoming the core platform for Comcast's next generation billing transformation program. Comcast shares the best practices, scaling considerations, and migration strategies they employed.

title: [REPEAT 1] Automate Testing & Deployment of Modern Serverless Apps
abstract: Continuous deployment enables you to be more productive and deliver a more stable product. In this session, learn how to utilize CI/CD techniques when deploying AWS services like AWS Step Functions, Amazon API Gateway, and AWS Lambda resources. Get into the nuts and bolts of handling versions, testing, and deploying using AWS CodePipeline, and monitoring performance using Amazon CloudWatch.

title: [REPEAT 1] Architecting for the Cloud
abstract: Bring your ideas, war stories, and "aha moments" to this interactive session with an AWS solutions architect, where we discuss cloud architecture best practices. We highlight specific "light bulb" moments for AWS customers as the cloud redefined how they think about scalability, designing for failure, constrained thinking, elasticity, parallel processing, loose coupling, and more. Come with your own story or an interest in learning how AWS forever changed the way your colleagues think about the IT world.

title: Migrate from Teradata to Amazon Redshift: Best Practices with McDonald's
abstract: Modernizing your data warehouse can unlock new insights while substantially improving query and data load performance, increasing scalability, and saving costs. In this chalk talk, we discuss how to leverage the AWS Database Migration Service and AWS Schema Conversion Tool to migrate from Teradata to Amazon Redshift. McDonald's joins us to share their migration journey, after which they were able to run ~7,000 reports across four AWS Regions, enabling new reporting capabilities for marketing, franchises, supply chain, pricing, and many more business units.

title: Deep Dive into Container Networking
abstract: Building microservices lets you decouple parts of your application so you can develop and deploy code faster. But once your microservices are running, how do you ensure they can seamlessly communicate with each other? In this session, we dive deep into microservices networking. We discuss how you can build, secure, and manage the communications into, out of, and between the various microservices that make up your application. We also cover key topics like service discovery, deployments, latency, and service mesh.

title: [REPEAT 1] Executing a Large Scale Migration to AWS
abstract: Enterprise customers who are planning to lift and shift out of a data center and move to AWS rely on discovery and migration tools for fast and reliable mass migrations. In this session, we show you how to quickly discover and asses your existing IT infrastructure using AWS Application Discovery Service. We also discuss best practices for automating discovery and migration execution. Finally, we dive deep into using AWS Migration Hub with AWS migration tools, like AWS Server Migration Service, and partner tools to track and execute application migrations at scale.

title: Containerizing Legacy .NET Workloads
abstract: ASP.NET MVC 4.6 and earlier versions of ASP.NET occupy a significant footprint in the enterprise web application space. As enterprises move toward microservices for new or existing applications, containers are one of the stepping stones for migrating from monolithic to microservices architectures. In this session, we cover best practices and required steps for successfully moving legacy .NET workloads to containers using Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) and other AWS tools.

title: Spot with Amazon EKS
abstract: Amazon EC2 Spot Instances save money by giving you compute at up to 90 percent less than On-Demand Instances. In this session, we show you how to add Spot Instances to your Kubernetes cluster managed by Amazon EKS. We discuss best practices for using Spot Instances with containers, including building heterogeneous clusters and gracefully handling terminations.

title: [REPEAT 1] Advanced Traffic Management with Amazon Route 53 Traffic Flow
abstract: As companies look to improve performance and availability for their users by expanding their architecture's global footprint, it can become complex to manage routing and traffic to multiple network resources, such as web servers, app servers, and load balancers across multiple locations. Amazon Route 53 Traffic Flow provides a policy-based management interface you can use to easily control your application's global traffic based on latency, health, and other considerations. In this session, we show you how to use Traffic Flow to solve routing and traffic management use cases while taking advantage of code control and versioning for easier management of your traffic management configuration.

title: [REPEAT 1] Building a Business Case for Your Cloud Journey
abstract: Favorable economics is the obvious compelling business case to move to the cloud, but it is only part of the total picture. When preparing a business case for migrating to the cloud, many organizations focus on improvements in total cost of ownership. However, the cloud can provide benefits in additional areas, such as technology optimization, cost of change, and business value. In this session, learn a framework and the tools that are available to create a compelling business case for a large-scale migration to AWS.

title: Using Amazon Mechanical Turk to Crowdsource Data Collection
abstract: Companies and researchers are increasingly turning to low-cost crowdsourcing platforms, like Amazon Mechanical Turk (Mechanical Turk), for data collection. Whether you’re trying to assemble all the IMDB entries for a long list of movies or find the websites of several hundred companies, Mechanical Turk enables you to easily gather the information you need. In this session, we share how you can get started with crowdsourced data collection using Mechanical Turk, and how some companies are using it today.

title: Considerations for Building Your First Streaming Application
abstract: Do you want to increase your knowledge of AWS big data web services and launch your first big data application on the cloud? In this chalk talk, we provide an overview of many of the AWS analytics services, including Amazon EMR, Amazon Kinesis, Amazon Athena, and Amazon Redshift. We discuss how they are architected together to solve common big data problems, such as ingestion, ETL, and real-time analytics.

title: Translating Web Content Easily with Language Services from AWS
abstract: Providing multilingual content represents a great opportunity for site owners. Although English is the dominant language of the web, native English speakers comprise only 26% of the total online audience. In this chalk talk, we discuss how you can make your web content more accessible with text-to-speech and machine translation. By offering written and audio versions of your content in multiple languages, you can meet the needs of a larger international audience.

title: [REPEAT] Well-Architected for Security
abstract: Security is an ongoing effort. In this session, we discuss best practice guidance for architecting secure systems on AWS, including identity and access management, traceability, automation, data protection, and incident response. Security is an ongoing effort. In this session, we discuss best practice guidance for architecting secure systems on AWS, including identity and access management, traceability, automation, data protection, and incident response. The Well-Architected framework has been developed to help cloud architects build the most secure, high-performing, resilient, and efficient infrastructure possible for their applications. This framework provides a consistent approach for customers and partners to evaluate architectures, and provides guidance to help implement designs that will scale with your application needs over time.

title: Using Containers and Serverless to Deploy Microservices
abstract: Microservices are a great way to segment your application into well-defined, self-contained units of functionality. Come join us in this chalk talk as we discuss two common architectures for deploying microservices: containers and serverless.

title: [REPEAT 3]: Chalk Talk: Deep Dive on Security in Amazon S3 & Amazon Glacier
abstract: Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier provide some of the most enhanced data security features available in the cloud today. In this chalk talk, learn directly from the AWS engineering team that builds and maintains Amazon S3 security functionality, like encryption, public access visibility, and much more. Bring your feedback, questions, and expertise to discuss innovative ways to ensure that your data is available only to the users and applications that need it.

title: [REPEAT 1] Optimizing Performance in Amazon S3
abstract: Amazon S3 powers some of the most performance-sensitive workloads running in the cloud today. 2018 has brought massive improvements in Amazon S3 request rates and overall throughput. In this chalk talk, you have the opportunity to interact directly with the Amazon S3 engineering team responsible for the S3 index and many other components at the core of these improvements. We discuss what's changed, including the removal of the need for prefix randomization, and the ways you can improve your architecture to enhance performance in the unique environment of Amazon S3.

title: [REPEAT] IoT Microcontrollers and Getting Started with Amazon FreeRTOS
abstract: Come explore the challenges of embedded development, and learn to use Amazon FreeRTOS to solve these challenges. We cover differentiated features, such as tickless mode for low power consumption and the ecosystem of tools available for development, test, and debug. We also discuss use cases and their choice of microcontroller architecture.

title: [REPEAT] Deploy Serverless Apps with Python: AWS Chalice Deep Dive
abstract: AWS Chalice is a microframework for writing serverless applications in Python. It enables you to write and deploy serverless applications in minutes. In this session, we take a deep dive into Chalice. We take a sample Chalice application and walk through how Chalice builds and deploys it. This includes the deployment planner, automatic IAM policy generation, and how Chalice builds AWS Lambda deployment packages for Python. Come and hear from the core Chalice developers about best practices and how to get the most of the microframework. You'll be able to quickly develop and deploy serverless applications in no time.

title: [REPEAT] AWS Landing Zone Deep Dive
abstract: In this session, we discuss how to deploy a scalable environment that considers the AWS account structure, security services, network architecture, and user access. We present an overview of the AWS Landing Zone solution, an automated solution for setting up a robust and flexible AWS environment designed from the collective experience of AWS and our customers. The AWS Landing Zone helps automate the setup of a flexible account structure, security baseline, network structure, and user access based on best practices. Future growth is facilitated by an account vending machine component that simplifies the creation of additional accounts. Learn how the AWS Landing Zone can ensure that you start your AWS journey with the right foundation. We encourage you to attend the full AWS Landing Zone track, including SEC303. Search for #awslandingzone in the session catalog.

title: Creating Rich, Interactive Business Dashboards in Amazon QuickSight
abstract: Are you ready to move past static email reports, Excel spreadsheets, and one-time queries? In this session, learn to build a rich and interactive business dashboard in Amazon QuickSight that allows your business stakeholders to filter, slice and dicem and deep dive on their own. We’ll demonstrate some advanced QuickSight capabilities such as creating on sheet filter controls, parameters, custom URLs, and table calculations to create powerful, easy-to-use, and interactive executive dashboards.

title: [REPEAT] A DIY Guide to Runbooks, Security Incident Reports, & Incident Response
abstract: In this session, we discuss how you should be building your runbooks and security incident report system (SIRS) using your company's real-world configuration and processes. Our goal is to give you an easier way to start your runbooks and create a SIRS. Now you can be the hero for your company by building a strategy and finding out how secure you are. You also learn more about why you should be running a DevSecOps pipeline and how it will help your team find threats in your production environment. Finally, learn how things are different in each level of environment and where your developers should be working.

title: Kickstart Your All-In Move to the AWS Cloud Using AWS Storage Gateway and Amazon EFS
abstract: When you move your data center to the AWS Cloud, you need an innovative and cost-effective approach to ensure a successful transition. In this chalk talk, we discuss how to efficiently and securely migrate all of your data center workloads to the AWS Cloud. Hear how one customer, LoanLogics, started with AWS Storage Gateway and Amazon EFS to solve an immediate and urgent expansion challenge and used that as a starting point for their journey to the AWS Cloud. Hear how they took advantage of the agility of the cloud to transition their storage and database workloads to Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS. Learn tips to ease your own transition to the cloud. Bring your questions, prepare to discuss your implementation, and expect to have a deep discussion on how you can optimize your workflows.

title: [REPEAT] Accelerate Applications with Custom Hardware & Amazon EC2 F1 Instances
abstract: Amazon EC2 F1 instances with field programmable gate arrays (FPGAs), combined with optimized cloud-based FPGA programming tools, provides researchers, application developers, and startups with a well-tested, standardized, and accessible platform for custom hardware-accelerated computing. In this session, we dive deep on how to code and compile C/C++ Black–Scholes acceleration workflow. We analyze the architecture, results, and methodologies used to achieve 400x acceleration compared to Amazon EC2 Standard compute instances. Guest speakers highlight how they're using F1 instances for their applications.

title: [REPEAT 1] Everything You Wanted to Know about Firewalls and Middle Boxes on AWS
abstract: In this interactive chalk talk, we briefly cover common architectures for inserting services like firewalls, routers, security services, and proxies in AWS. The majority of this session comprises whiteboarding network architectures to include middle boxes in AWS. This includes hybrid networks, multi-region connectivity, and new AWS services.

title: [CT] Petabyte-Scale Migration to Amazon S3: Building Photobox's Data Lake
abstract: Large-scale migration to the cloud can be complex and time-consuming. AWS solutions like AWS Snowball, AWS Snowball Edge, and AWS Snowmobile help customers move petabytes of data cost-effectively and without saturating a network connection for months at a time. In this chalk talk, hear about a real-world scenario with AWS customer, Photobox, Europe's leading provider of photobooks and other personalized items, who migrated over 10 PB of data to Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier using Snowball Edge to build their data lake. The technical architects responsible for this migration are available to answer detailed questions.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build AWS CloudFormation Custom Resources
abstract: Custom resources enable AWS CloudFormation customers to write customized provisioning logic in templates. Such logic can be useful in changing how existing resources get created, changed, or deleted, or in including resources that are not available as supported resource types. In this session, we cover best practices, including when to use custom resources versus other programmatic alternatives. We also cover existing custom resources that are available for download and reuse.

title: [REPEAT 1] Building Multi-Tenant SaaS Applications with AWS Lambda
abstract: In this session, Twilio and AWS solutions architects share how they each have built multi-tenant serverless solutions using services like AWS Lambda. Twilio kicks things off by sharing lessons learned through the process of creating their Twilio Function SaaS product leveraging AWS Lambda. Next, solutions architects cover other architectural patterns, including multi-tenancy, event-driven workflows using AWS Step Functions, and ways to leverage Amazon SQS and Amazon SNS to build distributed applications at scale.

title: Give REST a Rest: Easily Migrate Your APIs to GraphQL
abstract: You've probably invested quite a bit in RESTful APIs, but you've heard of GraphQL and AWS AppSync and want to take advantage of the new capabilities in your apps. In this session, we answer your questions on how to migrate your RESTful APIs to GraphQL easily while still maintaining backwards compatibility.

title: [REPEAT 2] Bridging Message Brokers to Cloud-Native Messaging Services
abstract: Learn how to connect your JMS-based applications to the cloud and integrate them with new cloud-native applications. In this session, we quickly refresh your knowledge about messaging enterprise integration patterns. We then discuss architectural examples to bridge the JMS-based and cloud-native worlds. We work through an example implementation based on Amazon MQ, Amazon SQS, and Amazon SNS. Leave this session with a solid understanding of how to connect existing applications to new cloud-native applications using messaging patterns.

title: [REPEAT] Hybrid Identity Management and Security for Large Enterprises
