We demonstrate advanced Amazon QuickSight capabilities such as creating on-sheet filter controls, parameters, custom URLs, and table calculations to create rich and attractive executive dashboards.

title: [REPEAT] Build a Serverless Online Analytical Processing App for Financial Services
abstract: In this session, we focus on building an OLAP application that is fit for use in financial institutions and that is entirely serverless. The application uses AWS Glue for extract, transform, and load operations, Amazon S3 for highly available and durable storage, and Amazon Athena to query the data. The solution also uses Amazon QuickSight to provide dashboards and reports. At the end of this session, participants should have a fully functioning OLAP application that they can apply to multiple use cases in financial services.

title: [REPEAT 2] Building Multi-Region Microservices
abstract: In this session, participate in a hands-on exercise where you create, verify, and test a serverless solution across multiple regions using AWS Lambda and Amazon DynamoDB global tables.

title: [REPEAT 7] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.

title: [REPEAT 3] Move Your First Application to the Cloud with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: Ever wonder exactly how to get started with AWS? In this session, come spend time with the Amazon Lightsail team, and move one of your applications to the cloud. We sit down with you and help you deploy a workload on AWS using Amazon Lightsail. So bring your own workload or use one of our demo examples, and get started today.

title: [REPEAT 2] Amazon Redshift Workload Management - Deep Dive
abstract: In this session, we walk you though the new features of Amazon Redshift workload management and the potential it offers to tune your cluster for the best query performance for your workloads. You'll be empowered with tools and tips to understand your current configuration and how to perform the needed optimizations. Walk away from the session with the confidence that your clusters are firing on all cylinders.

title: [REPEAT 5] Migrate Your First SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS for SQL Server
abstract: With the approaching end of support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008, it is important to understand your options for upgrading the database layer of your existing applications. The fully managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for SQL Server makes it easy to upgrade, set up, operate, and scale your SQL Server business applications for high availability. Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to migrate a SQL Server database to Amazon RDS.

title: Using NICE DCV to Visualize your HPC Simulations
abstract: In this builder session, we cover the basics of setting up a remote visualization session for HPC workloads.

title: [REPEAT] Security Incident Automation for PCI DSS Compliance
abstract: In this session, you learn how to use Amazon GuardDuty to implement automated controls for PCI DSS requirement 12.9 in your PCI-controlled Amazon EC2 environment. The PCI DSS requirement 12.9 says: Implement an incident response plan. Be prepared to respond immediately to a system breach. In this session, we simulate an instance compromise scenario that triggers a series of automated steps to isolate the instance, notify SecOps, and capture a forensics snapshot.

title: [REPEAT 2] Build a Serverless Media Analysis & Image Processing Solution
abstract: Use AWS Step Functions along with Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Transcribe, and Amazon Comprehend to build a serverless application that extracts meaningful data from audio, image, and video files.

title: [REPEAT 2] Optimizing Your Immersive Application: Tips & Tricks from the Experts
abstract: In this this session, we provide insights into advanced settings to increase the performance of your scene by optimizing the environment, adjusting settings, modifying asset size, etc. Come prepared to raise questions, discuss challenges, and create solutions with experienced Amazon Sumerian experts.

title: [REPEAT 3] Build on Amazon Aurora with MySQL Compatibility
abstract: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database with the speed, reliability, and availability of commercial databases at one-tenth the cost. Join this session, and get started with the MySQL-compatible edition, discuss your existing application running on Aurora, or learn about recently announced features, such as Serverless or Parallel Query.

title: [REPEAT 1] Migrate Your SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS
abstract: If you're moving your SQL Server databases to the cloud, Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) provides you with several options. Join this session to learn about Amazon RDS for SQL Server, discuss the functionality that it supports, and see how to convert and migrate your database to Amazon Aurora for high performance and availability at one-tenth the cost.

title: [REPEAT 1] Sizing Amazon Elasticsearch Service for Your Workload
abstract: Amazon Elasticsearch Service (Amazon ES) provides you with a great deal of flexibility in selecting the instance type and count for your data and master instances. In this session, we talk over your workload, the choices you can make, and how to optimize your Amazon ES deployment for cost and latency.

title: [REPEAT 1] Encryption in Transit Approaches for AWS Direct Connect
abstract: In this session, learn how to build a VPN overlay on AWS Direct Connect such that all traffic over the connection is encrypted. Bring your laptop.

title: VMware on AWS for Healthcare
abstract: In this builders session, learn how to get started with the VMware on AWS solution for your healthcare organization. Ask questions of a Senior Solutions Architect who is working in the healthcare industry.

title: Native iOS Test Automation for Developers
abstract: In this builders session, we write XCUI tests for iOS from scratch and run the tests against real devices in the cloud.

title: [REPEAT] Build Multichannel Conversational Interfaces Using Amazon Lex
abstract: Learn how to build a multichannel conversational interface that uses a preprocessing layer in front of Amazon Lex, or route messages to other specialized bots. Amazon Lex offers built-in integrations with Slack, Twilio, Marketo, Salesforce, QuickBooks, Microsoft Dynamics, Zendesk, and HubSpot. Also learn how to integrate with any other application by combining the Amazon Lex API and Amazon API Gateway to integrate your Amazon Lex bot with any messaging service.

title: [REPEAT 1] Cloud Data Migration with Amazon EBS
abstract: In this session, we focus on the fundamentals for beginning your SAN migration strategy to the cloud. Get hands-on experience setting up Amazon EBS volumes, and learn how to optimize your volumes for performance, availability, and durability.

title: [REPEAT 1] Architecture Patterns for Natural Language Solutions: Tips & Tricks
abstract: Amazon brings natural language processing, automatic speech recognition, text-to-speech, and neural machine translation technologies within reach of every developer. Come to this session and learn how to build smarter applications or automate workflows with AWS language services.

title: [REPEAT 3] Build a .NET CI/CD Pipeline with AWS & AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a .NET CI/CD pipeline with AWS and AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services.

title: [REPEAT 4] Deploy and Scale a Multi-Tier Application with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: You're just getting started on your cloud journey. Perhaps you've deployed a simple application on AWS, but you're curious about how you can manage more complex workloads. In this session, we walk through some considerations to keep in mind when deploying multi-tier applications. We can even migrate one of your applications, or you can try it out on one of our demo apps.

title: [REPEAT] Build an End-To-End IoT Example with AWS IoT Core
abstract: In this session, participate in a hands-on exercise with AWS IoT Core. You begin by leveraging the AWS IoT Device SDKs to securely connect to AWS IoT, then you modify and send sample data over MQTT to AWS IoT Core. Lastly, you learn how to make that data actionable by leveraging the AWS IoT rules engine. By the end of the session, expect to have a solid understanding of how AWS IoT works and how to begin using AWS IoT in your applications.

title: Advanced GraphQL Design Patterns with AWS AppSync
abstract: A well-designed GraphQL schema goes a long way towards ensuring a performant API. In this session, we dive deep into the GraphQL execution process. We then design optimal schemas for use with AWS AppSync, native resolvers, and subscriptions that work for common integration scenarios. We also cover best practices related to authentication and identity with GraphQL.

title: [REPEAT 7] Speed Alexa Skills Development with the ASK CLI
abstract: Build, manage, and deploy your Alexa skills programmatically from the command line using the ASK command line interface (CLI).

title: Deploy Deep Learning Models with AWS Lambda
abstract: In this session, we show you how to use your own custom-trained models with AWS Lambda to leverage a simplified serverless computing approach at scale. In the process, we introduce you to some of the core AWS services that you can use to run your inference with serverless, including Lambda, Amazon S3, AWS CloudFormation, Amazon CloudWatch, and IAM. The languages and deep learning frameworks we use include Python and TensorFlow. In addition, we show you how the processes can be applied with any other deep learning frameworks, such as MXNet, Caffe, PyTorch, and CNTK.

title: [REPEAT 2] Using AWS CloudFormation to Manage Networking in AWS
abstract: In this session, learn how to deploy a complete networking environment on AWS using AWS CloudFormation. By the end of this session, you will be confident in managing your infrastructure as code. Bring your laptops.

title: [REPEAT] Scalable Text Mining for ETL Solutions
abstract: While many ETL tools can handle structured data, very few can reliably process unstructured data and documents. In this session, learn how you can use Amazon Comprehend to address unstructured data extraction and transformation at scale so that key information can be extracted and used downstream for data integration and analytics.

title: [REPEAT 1] Create Your First AR/VR Scene in 60 Minutes
abstract: This hands-on session, we provide an orientation to the Amazon Sumerian console, IDE, scene templates, and asset library. By the end of this session, all participants will know how to set up an account, establish a scene template, and develop their first scene.

title: [REPEAT 1] Best Practices for Working with Large-Scale Geospatial Imagery
abstract: Across the commercial and public sectors, companies are working with large geospatial datasets. In this session, we review how to use various services, including Amazon S3, Amazon Glacier, Amazon Athena, AWS Batch, and AWS Step Functions to store, process, and get insights into your large geospatial datasets.

title: [REPEAT 1] Writing Elasticsearch Queries for Search
abstract: The Elasticsearch query DSL is feature-rich, providing you with the ability to write queries that quickly isolate and expose the information that's most important to you. Whether you're searching log data or application data, you need to understand the capabilities and how to use them. Let's dig in together and build the queries and ranking that you want.

title: Serverless Stream Processing with AWS Lambda
abstract: Streaming data ingestion and near real-time analysis give you immediate insights into your data. By using AWS Lambda with Amazon Kinesis, you can obtain these insights without the need to manage servers. In this builders session, we discuss how you can use Lambda and Kinesis together to build an end-to-end serverless solution.

title: [REPEAT 2] Deploy a Resilient and Cost-Effective App with Auto Scaling and CI/CD
abstract: Continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) with Auto Scaling can accelerate feature delivery, ensure the highest availability, and lower costs. In this session, we provide a hands-on experience in deploying your web app in an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group and setting up a CI/CD pipeline with AWS CodeDeploy and AWS CodePipeline. Learn best practices for setting up your Auto Scaling groups and scaling policies for a resilient infrastructure environment at the lowest cost.

title: When Mobile Apps Connect to the Cloud: Top Ten Problems & How to Avoid Them
abstract: When building cloud-connected mobile apps, you want to give users an amazing experience while still ensuring security and scalability. In this session, we work through the top ten problems in mobile app development for the cloud, and we discuss how to ensure that you don't make the same mistakes.

title: [REPEAT 1] Manage Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling Groups via AWS CloudFormation & Launch Templates
abstract: In this session, we focus on launch templates and their usage through Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling and AWS CloudFormation. Launch templates are designed to be an interactive, hands-on environment for anything you want to build. Learn about managing your Auto Scaling groups using launch templates. Roll up your sleeves, get your laptop out, and ask us anything you want to about your project.

title: [BS] Amazon EMR: Optimize Transient Clusters for Data Processing and ETL
abstract: Amazon EMR was built for agility, enabling you to spin up and down resources for big data processing and analytics on demand, and realize the flexible potential of cloud. In this builders session, we detail how to efficiently start, stop, and resize your clusters for Apache Spark and Hadoop, reducing your costs, and accelerating your "time-to-completion" for jobs. Join us to hear expert advice on how to optimize your "one and done" workloads.

title: A/B Testing Application Behavior to Improve User Experience and Retention
abstract: In this session, learn how to personalize and improve the look, feel, and behavior of your app and increase engagement and retention by combining AWS AppSync and Amazon Pinpoint for segmentation, A/B testing, and personalization.

title: [REPEAT 2] Build on Amazon Aurora with PostgreSQL Compatibility
abstract: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database with the speed, reliability, and availability of commercial databases at one-tenth the cost. Join this session, and get started with the PostgreSQL-compatible edition, discuss your existing application running on Aurora, or learn about recently announced features, such as Fast Database Cloning or Performance Insights.

title: [REPEAT 6] Add Screen Support to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, you work with Echo Show to see how to add visual components to your conversational experiences.

title: [REPEAT 1] Empower Lean Teams with Centrally Governed CI/CD Pipelines Using AWS CodePipeline & AWS Service Catalog
abstract: In this session, build a pipeline product that your lean teams can use to bring their application code, tests, and infrastructure to be vetted, executed, approved, and eventually published with AWS Service Catalog.

title: [REPEAT] Performance & Cost Optimization at Scale with Amazon S3 & Amazon Glacier
abstract: In this session, get hands on with Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier, an extremely low-cost storage class in S3 for data archiving and long-term backup.  Learn best practices for reducing storage costs, ensuring data lifecycle management, and balancing retrieval times and cost through the various restore tiers and SLAs.

title: [REPEAT 2] How to Use Cost Explorer and Budgets to Manage Your AWS Costs
abstract: Understanding, analyzing, controlling, and optimizing your AWS costs is easier than ever with our native AWS products. In this interactive session, we cover the basic and advanced capabilities of Cost Explorer, AWS Budgets, and their associated APIs. We also provide hands-on training for how to use these products effectively in real-world environments.

title: [REPEAT 2] Shared Services VPCs: VPC Peering & AWS PrivateLink Designs
abstract: This is a hands-on session where you are guided on how to create a shared services VPC. Shared services VPCs often contain resources like authentication, security services, logging, and more. We provide examples of how to share these services over both AWS PrivateLink and VPC peering. Bring your laptops.

title: [REPEAT 1] Building & Architecting ML Workstreams for Topic Modeling
abstract: Decoupling and optimizing machine learning (ML) workstreams is top of mind for all AWS customers. In this session, we use Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Comprehend to build and architect a streamlined ML workstream that shows how to extract keywords and topic modeling from text. We train models and cluster articles, and we find insights and relationships between the data and correlate it to provide business value. We also explore the workstream integration with Amazon S3 and AWS Glue. We discuss different approaches, best practices, and building blocks of an ML environment. This session enables ML developers and architects to create decoupled ML workstreams for any text data, such as news feeds, case management, and journals.

title: [REPEAT 1] Amazon SageMaker and PyTorch: Tips & Tricks
abstract: In this session, learn how to use PyTorch in the Amazon SageMaker machine learning platform.

title: [REPEAT 2] AWS Networking for Network Engineers
abstract: This is a hands-on and explorative session on what network engineers need to know about VPC mechanics and networking. We include hands-on exercises to demonstrate some differences in networking as well as the things that network engineers should know about AWS. Bring your laptops.

title: Deploying a Burstable and Event-Driven HPC Cluster on AWS
abstract: In this session, we guide participants through the process of setting up a Slurm head node that is managing an on-premises compute cluster to support bursting to AWS.

title: [REPEAT 1] Manage Long-Lived Transactions with AWS Step Functions
abstract: AWS Step Functions is a fully-managed serverless workflow-management service. Using visual workflows, you can easily manage long-running processes and coordinate the components of distributed applications and microservices through visual workflows. Join us to learn how you can use Step Functions to implement the Saga design pattern, which is particularly useful for dealing with the complexities of a long-lived transaction that spans across distributed components in a microservices architecture. You need your own laptop with administrator privileges, both the AWS CLI and AWS SAM CLI installed, and an active AWS account with power user access.

title: Getting Started with Amazon Neptune and Amazon SageMaker Jupyter Notebooks
abstract: Amazon SageMaker makes it easy to use Jupyter Notebooks. In this session, learn how to connect Jupyter Notebooks to your Amazon Neptune instance. You also have the opportunity to build graph queries to leverage graph data.

title: [REPEAT 2] Perform Diagnostics on Running Instances without Affecting Availability/Reliability
abstract: In this Builder Session, we demonstrate how remove an instance from an auto-scaling group. We use AWS Service Catalog to provision a bastion, and then we use AWS Systems Manager to provision SSH access for a limited time to perform diagnostics. When we complete, access will be removed, and the bastion will be decommissioned. Attendees need an account that can provision AWS Lambda, Amazon EC2, AWS Service Catalog, AWS Systems Manager, and Amazon CloudWatch Events.

title: How to Debug an Android App in the Cloud Using Android Studio
abstract: When developing mobile apps, sometimes you don’t have the right device in hand to reproduce a problem. AWS Device Farm has thousands of devices available, and you can use these to diagnose the problem. In this session, we show you how to install and run your app using a device in the cloud, use the Android Studio debugger to diagnose the problem by setting breakpoints and stepping through the code, measure app performance using Android Profiler, and write sample tests using instrumentation to ensure the problem is tested in the future.

title: [REPEAT 2] Automate Common Maintenance & Deployment Tasks Using AWS Systems Manager
abstract: AWS Systems Manager provides predefined automation documents for common operational tasks that can be customized to meet your specific use cases. In this session, learn how to build new or customize existing automation documents leveraging predefined documents, automation plugins, and environment variables. Use Systems Manager’s built-in rate controls to incrementally and safely roll out changes when stopping, starting, or restarting Amazon EC2 instances, updating Linux and Windows Amazon Machine Images, or updating software on multiple Amazon EC2 instances.

title: Multi-Region REST APIs with Automatic Failover
abstract: In this session, learn how to create multi-region REST APIs with the Amazon API Gateway with automatic failover. We show you how to create an API, configure a custom domain name, and set up Amazon Route 53 to work with this setup.

title: Weather Modeling with WRF on AWS
abstract: In this session, we guide participants on setting up their HPC environment to run weather research and forecasting (WRF) application on AWS. We provide tips and tricks to optimize the weather modeling application.

title: Working with Relational Databases in AWS Glue ETL
abstract: AWS Glue makes it easy to incorporate data from a variety of sources into your data lake on Amazon S3. In this builder's session, we discuss how to work with data residing in relational databases such as Amazon Aurora, Amazon Redshift, and PostgreSQL. Learn how to set up your network so that your AWS Glue job can access data residing in your virtual private cloud (VPC), tune queries so that they can effectively utilize parallel connections, and work with job bookmarks to load only new data into your data lake.

title: [REPEAT 2] Build High-Performance Apps with Amazon ElastiCache
abstract: Amazon ElastiCache offers fully managed Redis and Memcached, which you can use to seamlessly deploy, run, and scale popular open-source compatible in-memory data stores. Come to this session to learn how to build data-intensive apps or improve the performance of your existing apps by retrieving data from high throughput and low latency in-memory data stores.

title: Build Human-in-the-Loop Systems with AWS Lambda and Mechanical Turk
abstract: Building human-in-the-loop solutions can be very effective, but integrating humans into existing ML or business process workflows can be complex. Learn how you can easily connect the Amazon Mechanical Turk (Mechanical Turk) on-demand human intelligence platform with other AWS services, such as Amazon S3, Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, and Amazon Rekognition with AWS Lambda.

title: [REPEAT 3] Build a Real-Time Kibana Dashboard for Your Contact Center Data
abstract: Learn how to build a real-time Kabana Contact Center dashboard leveraging services such as Amazon Kinesis, AWS Lambda, Amazon Athena, and ASW Glue. You will have a real-time view of your contact centre data to gain insights into areas such as the customer journey, KPI's, and monitoring your contact centre experience. We will also show how you can use other AI services such as Amazon Comprehend and Amazon Transcribe to get additional sentiment data about your agents and customers.

title: [REPEAT] AWS Tools for PowerShell
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to explore several PowerShell use cases on AWS.

title: [REPEAT 6] Migrate Your First SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS for SQL Server
abstract: With the approaching end of support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008, it is important to understand your options for upgrading the database layer of your existing applications. The fully managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for SQL Server makes it easy to upgrade, set up, operate, and scale your SQL Server business applications for high availability. Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to migrate a SQL Server database to Amazon RDS.

title: Distributing and Securing Third-Party Software Products Across AWS
abstract: In this session, you build a custom, self-service catalog of third-party products from AWS Marketplace for your teams. Then, using AWS Service Catalog, we show you how to distribute that catalog of products to authorized users across multiple AWS regions and accounts within your organization. You learn how to enforce tagging, maintain your corporate security posture, and enable budget controls.

title: [REPEAT 1] Set up a Serverless App Using React and AWS Amplify
abstract: In this demonstration, we show you how easy it is to build a fully functional, secure cloud native application in hours rather than in days or weeks. We include the use of AWS Cloud9, a cloud-based IDE, to build a fully serverless cloud native application in React using the AWS Mobile Hub via the AWS Mobile CLI and AWS Amplify.

title: [REPEAT 1] What Shall I Wear Today? Modifying the Appearance of Your Sumerian Host
abstract: In this session, learn about the different ways you can customize the appearance of your Sumerian Host. We developed these customizations based on customer feedback. Discover how you can choose among four outfits for your Host, the color of those outfits, as well as your own specific logo. See how the different ways to configure the Host's appearance enables you to create a virtual avatar that is authentic to the experience you want to create and to your brand.

title: [REPEAT 2] Design and Configure Advanced Routing Strategies for Amazon Connect
abstract: In this session, you will learn how to customize the routing in Amazon Connect for scenarios such as VIP customers, second tier and fallback support, and holiday or emergency handling. We will guide you through building queues, routing profiles, and contact flows to solve for these advanced routing use cases. In the second half of this session, we'll explore how to solve for specific routing use cases you may have.

title: [REPEAT 1] Amazon S3 Performance and Cost Optimization
abstract: Amazon S3 supports reporting and management tools designed to help users optimize their storage for performance and cost. In this builders session, customers will learn how to create lifecycle policies to automatically move less-frequently accessed data to cheaper storage tiers. Amazon S3 experts will walk through Amazon S3 Inventory, object tagging, the Amazon S3 storage tiers, and Amazon S3 analytics storage class analysis (which observes object access patterns). Familiarity with Amazon S3 and the management console is recommended.

title: [REPEAT 2] AWS DeepLens Projects: Tips & Tricks
abstract: In this session, get general help on how to build or extend a project with AWS DeepLens.

title: [REPEAT 1] Amazon SageMaker and Chainer: Tips & Tricks
abstract: In this session, learn how to use Chainer, an open-source deep learning framework written in Python, in the Amazon SageMaker machine learning platform.

title: [REPEAT 2] Audit Your Device Fleet with AWS IoT Device Defender
abstract: AWS IoT Device Defender helps continuously audit security configurations for compliance with security best practices. Audits are performed for one or more sets of checks and can be configured to send notifications to SNS with findings. In this session, we walk through creating scheduled audits that run periodically as well as on-demand. We also walk through how to perform mitigation actions based on audit findings.

title: [REPEAT 1] Modernize Your First Windows Application with Windows Containers
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to modernize a sample .NET application to run inside a Windows container from start to finish in 60 minutes.

title: [REPEAT 1] Deploy Your Jenkins Pipeline to AWS & Optimize Your Builds
abstract: In this session, we help Jenkins users release on AWS quickly and easily. We install AWS CodeBuild to optimize your Jenkins builds and set up automatic deployments with AWS CodeDeploy.

title: [REPEAT 4] How to Optimize TCO by Bringing Microsoft Licenses to AWS
abstract: Understanding the licensing options for Microsoft workloads on AWS is critical in achieving the lowest total cost of ownership (TCO) during a cloud migration. In this interactive session, we focus on best practices for bringing on-premises licenses to AWS, and we discuss how these choices impact TCO. Topics include license mobility, dedicated AWS infrastructure, development and testing, and the recently released Optimize CPU feature.

title: [REPEAT] Start Shifting SFTP Workflows to the Cloud Now
abstract: You've got SFTP. It's probably attached to that application you need to move to AWS. Or, you want to move your SFTP server to AWS so you can store the files you're exchanging in Amazon S3. In this session, sit down with an AWS expert and get hands on with setting up your own SFTP services in AWS. We use best practices and automation tricks to help streamline movement of your SFTP workflows into AWS without redoing your authentication schemes.

title: [REPEAT 3] Lifecycle Management of Amazon WorkSpaces Using the AWS Service Catalog Connector for ServiceNow
abstract: In this builder session, cloud architects, desktop managers, and ITSM leads learn how to use the AWS Service Catalog Connector to launch, operate, and manage Amazon WorkSpaces in ServiceNow. You also learn how to enable Amazon WorkSpaces user self-service capabilities, such as reboot and rebuild. You can use the capabilities and learn to build a governance and management framework for your Amazon WorkSpaces environment that incorporates self-service capabilities to reduce your management overhead.

title: [REPEAT 1] Increase Your Data Engineering Productivity: Use Jupyter Notebooks with Amazon EMR
abstract: Adoption of Jupyter Notebooks gives big data customers an easy way to leverage the open source Apache Spark in Amazon EMR for data science, interactive analytics, and to prototype jobs before bringing them to production. In this builders session, we show you how to make Amazon EMR an even simpler to use platform for developers and data engineers, increasing their productivity as they collaborate on different workloads and different clusters.

title: [REPEAT] Selecting the Right Storage for Your HPC Workload
abstract: In this session, we discuss the factors you should consider in selecting the right storage solution for your HPC workload.

title: [REPEAT 1] Create an Augmented Reality Application with Amazon Sumerian
abstract: Sumerian's browser-based authoring tool reduces the complexity of creating an augmented reality (AR) application. In this session, participants learn how to use Sumerian in conjunction with ARKit and ARCore to create an augmented reality application that can be published to compatible iOS and Android smartphones.

title: [REPEAT 3] Which Database Should I Use?
abstract: Evaluating the best database to use for a job isn't as clear as it was ten years ago. Join us in this session to review your relational and nonrelational database options on AWS to ensure the best fit for your application. We also discuss related topics, such as managed database services, serverless databases, and heterogeneous migrations between different database types.

title: [REPEAT 8] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.

title: [REPEAT 2] Learn to Safely Deploy OTA Updates with AWS IoT Device Management
abstract: Interested in knowing how you can safely deploy over-the-air (OTA) updates with AWS IoT Device Management? In this session, learn how AWS IoT Device Management allows you to push software and firmware to devices in the field to patch security vulnerabilities and improve device functionality.

title: [REPEAT 1] Machine Learning in the Edge - Enhanced by Amazon Sumerian
abstract: In this session, learn how to integrate AWS IoT services, AWS Greengrass, Amazon Machine Learning, and Amazon Sumerian. We do a demonstration of real-time inference analysis of photographs for object recognition, and we hold a discussion on applying these capabilities to other use cases and industries.

title: [REPEAT 2] Manage Long-Lived Transactions with AWS Step Functions
abstract: AWS Step Functions is a fully-managed serverless workflow-management service. Using visual workflows, you can easily manage long-running processes and coordinate the components of distributed applications and microservices through visual workflows. Join us to learn how you can use Step Functions to implement the Saga design pattern, which is particularly useful for dealing with the complexities of a long-lived transaction that spans across distributed components in a microservices architecture. You need your own laptop with administrator privileges, both the AWS CLI and AWS SAM CLI installed, and an active AWS account with power user access.

title: [REPEAT 2] Infrastructure Protection in AWS
abstract: AWS provides security capabilities and services to increase privacy and control network access. In this session you'll learn how to enable network firewalls through Amazon VPC and security groups in Amazon EC2, plus consider connectivity options that enable private connections from your office or on-premises environment.

title: [REPEAT 8] Speed Alexa Skills Development with the ASK CLI
abstract: Build, manage, and deploy your Alexa skills programmatically from the command line using the ASK command line interface (CLI).

title: [REPEAT 2] Build a Genome Clustering Model with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: The development and application of machine learning (ML) models is a vital part of scientific and technical computing. Increasing model training data size generally improves model prediction and performance, but deploying models at scale is a challenge. Participants in this builder session learn to use Amazon SageMaker, an AWS service that simplifies the ML process and enables training on cloud-stored datasets at any scale. Attendees walk through the process of building a model, training it, and applying it for prediction against large open scientific datasets, such as the 1000 Genomes data. By the end of the session, attendees have the resources and experience to start using Amazon SageMaker and related AWS services to accelerate their scientific research and time to discovery.

title: Secure Your Site: Use CDN Security Features to Protect Your Content & Infrastructure
abstract: In this session, we review and configure several Amazon CloudFront security features such as TLS/SSL certificate management, security groups, OAI, token authentication, and field-level encryption.

title: [REPEAT 2] Automatically Extract Metadata Using Computer Vision & Language AI Services
abstract: Customers are using automatic metadata extraction to fuel new insights and provide innovative services to their customers. In this session, we walk through the basic architecture patterns for implementing automatic metadata extraction using Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Transcribe, and Amazon Comprehend. We also share how to get started with the pre-configured AWS Media Analysis Solution.

title: [REPEAT 7] Add Screen Support to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, you work with Echo Show to see how to add visual components to your conversational experiences.

title: [REPEAT 4] Move Your First Application to the Cloud with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: Ever wonder exactly how to get started with AWS? In this session, come spend time with the Amazon Lightsail team, and move one of your applications to the cloud. We sit down with you and help you deploy a workload on AWS using Amazon Lightsail. So bring your own workload or use one of our demo examples, and get started today.

title: [REPEAT 2] Detect Abnormal Device Behavior with AWS IoT Device Defender
abstract: AWS IoT Device Defender continuously monitors device behavior. You can define appropriate behaviors for your devices by selecting the right thresholds. In this session, we set up some thresholds and give you advice on best practices for how to select the right thresholds. AWS IoT Device Defender alerts you when behaviors are violated. We show you how to fine-tune the device behavior thresholds to match your use case.

title: [REPEAT 1] Manage Your IoT Device Lifecycle with AWS IoT Device Management
abstract: In this session, learn how to manage your device lifecycle from start to finish with AWS IoT Device Management. By the end of this session, expect to understand how to onboard devices, organize device inventory, monitor a fleet of devices, and remotely manage and update devices deployed across many locations.

title: [REPEAT 1] Upgrade AWS Direct Connect without Downtime
abstract: In this hands-on session, learn how to upgrade your AWS Direct Connect circuit without outages. We include details about failover, BGP settings, and how DX routing operates. Bring your laptop.

title: [REPEAT 2] AWS Systems Manager for Microsoft Workloads
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a management and patching strategy with AWS Systems Manager for on-premise and cloud resources.

title: [REPEAT 3] Use Amazon MQ to Connect On-Premises Messaging to the Cloud
abstract: In this session, learn how to use Amazon MQ to connect IBM MQ to the AWS cloud. We demonstrate how to set up an Amazon MQ message broker and start sending messages from IBM MQ to Amazon MQ.

title: Modern Android Application Architecture with AWS
abstract: In this session, we explore Android architecture components for lifecycle management, LiveData, ViewModel, and SQLite persistence, and we show you how you can access AWS services using this new Android architectural pattern.

title: [REPEAT 2] Migrate Your Oracle Database to Amazon RDS
abstract: If you're moving your Oracle databases to the cloud, Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) provides you with several options. Learn about Amazon RDS for Oracle, discuss the Oracle functionality that it supports, and see how to convert and migrate your database to Amazon Aurora for high performance and availability at one-tenth the cost.

title: [REPEAT 8] Build Your First Alexa Skill
abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.

title: Image Optimization at the Edge with Amazon CloudFront and Lambda@Edge
abstract: Image optimization saves time, money and creates a better user experience. In this session, configure a dynamically scalable real-time image optimization service to resize and compress images for various experiences and devices using Amazon Cloudfront and Lambda@Edge.

title: [REPEAT 2] Creating a Chatbot
abstract: In this hands-on training session, we show you how to create a chatbot using Sumerian Hosts integrated with Amazon Polly and Amazon Lex. Bringing voice and conversation transforms the way in which scenes are developed and how customers interact with an app. Learn how to create a chatbot using both verbal and typed inputs and responses.

title: Get the Most out of AWS Glue Data Catalog and Crawlers for Data Lake Analytics
abstract: In this builders session, we discuss common use cases across various AWS data analytics platforms that are integrated with AWS Glue Data Catalog, and share best practices for using AWS Glue Data Catalog and crawlers to optimize query performance on services such as Amazon Athena and Amazon Redshift Spectrum, and Amazon EMR. Participants set up and launch crawlers on sample datasets and execute queries on various analytics services.

title: Accelerate Your Migration with AWS Marketplace Migration Mapping Assistant
abstract: In this session, we dive deep into accelerating your migration to AWS by finding matching products from your existing inventory of on-premises applications with AWS Marketplace Migration Mapping Assistant. We show you how to import a list of your current software applications to AWS, and run a bulk search to find corresponding third-party products that are available to purchase and deploy from AWS Marketplace.

title: [REPEAT 1] Empower Lean Teams with Centrally Crafted CI/CD Pipelines Using AWS CodePipeline & AWS CloudFormation
abstract: In this one-hour session, you build a pipeline product that your lean teams can use to bring their application code, tests, and infrastructure to be vetted, executed, approved, and eventually published with AWS CloudFormation.

title: [REPEAT 4] Active Directory Domain Trusts and AWS SSO Jumpstart
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a domain trust between on-premises Active Directory and AWS Managed AD in AWS. As a bonus, learn how to connect AWS Managed AD to AWS SSO.

title: [REPEAT 1] Identify & Address Query Performance Issues in Aurora
abstract: In this session, we discuss and demonstrate techniques for identifying expensive queries using Amazon RDS Performance Insights as well as strategies for improving performance.  Intended audience is developers, DBAs, and DBEs who are using Aurora.

title: [REPEAT] Running High Performance Computing Workloads in the Cloud
abstract: In this session, we discuss best practices for running high performance computing (HPC) workloads on AWS, including considerations for selecting the right Amazon EC2 instance based on your workload type.

title: [REPEAT 1] Deploy a SQL Server Multi-Region Always On Availability Group Cluster
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to deploy a multi-region SQL Server Always-On Cluster.

title: [REPEAT 1] Amazon S3 Storage Management
abstract: Amazon S3 offers the most flexible management and administration capabilities to classify, report, and visualize your data usage trends so that you can make informed decisions to optimize performance and cost. Attend this builders session to learn how to use the following Amazon S3 management features: create and manage lifecycle policies, create and manage cross-region replication rules, configure storage class analysis, configure Amazon S3 inventory, and configure request metrics. You will also learn how to use the latest Amazon S3 features in a controlled setting with members from our Amazon S3 team. Some knowledge of storage management and familiarity of the Amazon S3 console is recommended but not necessary.

title: [REPEAT 1] Microservices Insights with AWS X-Ray
abstract: In this session, learn how to easily debug and trace unhandled errors, performance bottlenecks, and customer impact in the distributed nature of a microservices architecture.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build a Query to Analyze Data in Your Amazon Redshift Warehouse & S3 Data Lake Together
abstract: Not all of your data is always loaded into your data warehouse, and yet sometimes anaysts need access to it quickly, without waiting on an ETL job to load it. This sessions takes a hands-on approach to show you how to mine your Amazon S3 data lake using open data formats with Amazon Redshift Spectrum, a feature of Amazon Redshift, without the need for unnecessary data movement. This enables you to analyze data across your data warehouse and data lake together, with a single service.

title: [REPEAT 2] Build Internet-Scale Apps with Amazon DynamoDB
abstract: Amazon DynamoDB is a non-relational database that delivers reliable performance at any scale. It's a fully managed, multi-region, multi-master database that provides consistent single-digit millisecond latency, and it offers built-in security, backup and restore, and in-memory caching. Come to this session to learn how to build internet-scale apps with DynamoDB.

title: [REPEAT 2] Learn How to Perform OTA Updates on Amazon FreeRTOS
abstract: Software patching is one of the most important defensive security techniques for connected devices, including for IoT. Feature upgrades are also a common business requirement for staying competitive. Amazon FreeRTOS supports over-the-air (OTA) updates using AWS IoT Device Management in the cloud and a portable interface on the device. Come see a demo and learn how to use Amazon FreeRTOS OTA with your product.

title: Build OTT Workflows for VOD and Live Video Streaming on AWS
abstract: In this session, we show how to build a live channel and a file-based video on-demand (VOD) workflow quickly and easily by using AWS VOD and live video streaming solutions. Learn how to get broadcast-quality video using a well-architected, highly available workflow and how to customize, enhance, and continually improve your offerings from there. After a brief introduction on how to add advanced services such as machine learning (ML) to optimize the viewing experience, we discuss use cases and lessons learned from companies that built these workflows.

title: [REPEAT 4] Managing Application Costs and Performance Using AWS Auto Scaling
abstract: In this session, learn how AWS Auto Scaling enables you to configure scaling for all your application resources in as few as three steps.

title: [REPEAT 3] Build a Serverless .NET App on AWS Using the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to create and deploy a .NET serverless app on AWS using the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio.

title: Build Advanced Workflows with AWS Glue
abstract: AWS Glue makes it easy to incorporate data from a variety of sources into your data lake on Amazon S3. In this builders session, we demonstrate building complex workflows using AWS Glue orchestration capabilities. Learn about different types of AWS Glue triggers to create workflows for scheduled as well as event-driven processing. We start with a customer scenario and build it step by step using AWS Glue capabilities.

title: [REPEAT] How Financial Institutions Can Securely Migrate Commercial Databases to Aurora
abstract: In the financial services industry, it is common for databases to contain sensitive data, which can make migrating them to the public cloud a concern. In this session, we share best practices on securely migrating Oracle databases to Amazon Aurora MySQL and PostgreSQL using the AWS Database Migration Service and the AWS Schema Conversion Tool. We also explore using AWS Key Management Service to encrypt data during and after the migration.

title: [REPEAT 1] Modernize Your Data Warehouse with Amazon Redshift
abstract: As organizations move from aggregating data from disparate sources to preparing the data for analytical workloads, they're constantly bottlenecked by the infrastructural limitations of their data warehousing infrastructure. Moving to a managed cloud data warehouse seems to be costly and risk-prone. This session takes you through an approach, personalized to your use case, for modernizing your data warehouse infrastructure powered by Amazon Redshift. It shows you how easy it is to migrate your setup to the cloud through AWS Database Migration Service, as well as how to migrate petabytes of data to the cloud quickly and securely with AWS Snowball, AWS Snowmobile, and other migration services.

title: [REPEAT 2] Set Up a Serverless CI/CD Pipeline with AWS CodeStar
abstract: In this session, you start your first serverless application using AWS CodeStar to set up a CI/CD. Then, we debug our AWS Lambda functions using AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) Local with AWS Cloud9. Finally, we learn about monitoring distributed applications with AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch.

title: Deploy Business Analytics at Enterprise Scale with Amazon QuickSight
abstract: One of the biggest tradeoffs customers make when deploying BI solutions at scale is agility versus governance. Large-scale business intelligence (BI) implementations with the right governance structure can take months to design and deploy. In this session, learn how to avoid making this tradeoff using Amazon QuickSight. Learn how to easily deploy Amazon QuickSight to thousands of users using Active Directory and federated SSO, while securely accessing your data sources in Amazon VPCs or on premises. We also cover how to control access to datasets, implement row-level security, create scheduled email reports, and audit access to your data.

title: [REPEAT 2] Building Automated Actions Using AWS Trusted Advisor Checks
abstract: By using AWS Trusted Advisor checks in conjunction with AWS Lambda, AWS Step Functions, and AWS Systems Manager, we build from scratch automation to reduce risk, improve security, and optimize performance.

title: [REPEAT 1] Build Custom Models for AWS DeepLens with Amazon SageMaker
abstract: In this session, you will learn how to build and deploy computer vision models using the AWS DeepLens deep-learning-enabled video camera and Amazon SageMaker.

title: [REPEAT 1] Amazon SageMaker: Custom Algorithms
abstract: In this session, learn how to integrate custom algorithms into the Amazon SageMaker platform.

title: [REPEAT 2] Migrate Your SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS
abstract: If you're moving your SQL Server databases to the cloud, Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) provides you with several options. Join this session to learn about Amazon RDS for SQL Server, discuss the functionality that it supports, and see how to convert and migrate your database to Amazon Aurora for high performance and availability at one-tenth the cost.

title: [REPEAT 8] Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.

title: [REPEAT 5] Deploy and Scale a Multi-Tier Application with Amazon Lightsail
abstract: You're just getting started on your cloud journey. Perhaps you've deployed a simple application on AWS, but you're curious about how you can manage more complex workloads. In this session, we walk through some considerations to keep in mind when deploying multi-tier applications. We can even migrate one of your applications, or you can try it out on one of our demo apps.

title: [REPEAT 2] Deploy a SQL Server Failover Cluster on AWS
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to deploy a SQL Server Failover Cluster Instance on AWS.

title: [REPEAT 4] Build a .NET CI/CD Pipeline with AWS & AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services
abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a .NET CI/CD pipeline with AWS and AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services.

title: Getting Started with Knowledge Graphs in Amazon Neptune
abstract: Gain hands-on experience building a knowledge graph in Amazon Neptune. Participants have the opportunity to bring their own data and integrate it into a knowledge graph and to build SPARQL queries.

title: [REPEAT 9] Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill
abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.

title: [REPEAT] Use AWS PrivateLink to Create a URL-Filtering Reverse Proxy Fleet
abstract: This is an advanced hands-on session where you create a fleet of reverse proxy instances that will do URL filtering. Expect to learn about AWS PrivateLink, proxies, and cross-VPC connectivity. Bring your laptops.

title: [REPEAT 7] Migrate Your First SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS for SQL Server
abstract: With the approaching end of support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008, it is important to understand your options for upgrading the database layer of your existing applications. The fully managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for SQL Server makes it easy to upgrade, set up, operate, and scale your SQL Server business applications for high availability. Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to migrate a SQL Server database to Amazon RDS.

title: [REPEAT 1] Meet Cristine, Luke, Grace and Preston: Introduction to Sumerian Hosts (Virtual Avatars)
abstract: In this session, we introduce one of the most engaging features of the Amazon Sumerian service: Sumerian Hosts. Hosts are animated, interactive digital avatars that can be integrated into your 3D and augmented reality (AR) applications. Currently, there are three Hosts available: Cristine, Preston, and Luke. In this builders session, we walk through the capabilities of Sumerian Hosts and demonstrate how to create custom speeches. After this builders session, you will be able to start creating dynamic scenes that include Hosts.

title: [REPEAT 2] Scale up a Web Application
abstract: In this session, you use an automated test suite to bombard an application with an increasing number of concurrent users. You then identify the bottlenecks and refactor the application. Find out how many concurrent users can you get to.

title: [REPEAT 3] Deploy Your Web App Safely with Blue-Green Deployments
abstract: In this session, learn about reducing your production downtime with blue-green deployments. Learn how to quickly build your deployment pipeline using AWS CodePipeline, and take a deep dive into AWS CodeDeploy.

title: Create Live Sports Analytics with Machine Learning
abstract: Machine learning provides a new way of looking at sports analytics and experiencing sporting events. Custom-built models can now be used to provide live sports analytics. In this chalk talk, learn how to train models that can detect sports events, such as a substitutions, goals, and red cards, using services like Amazon Rekognition and Amazon Transcribe.

title: Under the Hood of Amazon Route 53
abstract: The engineering team that worked on Amazon Route 53 discuss its underlying implementation in a talk for developers and system operators of all kinds. We start by sharing insights and lessons learned on how to design, deploy, and operate your own services while meeting extreme demands for scale and availability. Many of the largest AWS services rely on Route 53 for DNS, as do many of the internet's busiest applications and websites. This talk takes you inside Route 53 as we look at how the engineering team runs a highly distributed service at massive scale while maintaining a 100% availability SLA.

title: Retail Marketing with Machine Learning & Amazon Rekognition
abstract: Retailers need to create individually tailored experiences to delight customers while more and more companies are leveraging technology to do so. In this chalk talk, we whiteboard the architecture and demonstrate Amazon Rekognition to understand how to automate the process of building personalized marketing solutions using ML-based machine vision and gather consumer insights using visualization tools. Audience participation is encouraged through a Q&A for retail marketing use cases like customer mood analysis, celebrity product placement marketing with social media, and store traffic analysis to drive merchandising decisions, planogram decisions, and overall product placement.

title: [REPEAT 2] How to Train Your Alexa Skill Language Model Using Machine Learning
abstract: In order to create an engaging Alexa skill, you must have a well-thought-out language model for your voice UI. In this session, learn how to make your Alexa skill more delightful to customers by optimizing your language model, providing the correct training data for your custom intents, and using specific strategies to improve new and existing language models. Come prepared for an interactive conversation.

title: Monetizing Live OTT Streams Made Easier
abstract: Monetizing live video streams can be a challenge. AWS Elemental MediaTailor can help make that challenge easier to overcome. For best returns, streaming video solutions should use server-side ad insertion, target different devices, personalize ads for each viewer, and be able to scale for the most popular events, like live sports. In this chalk talk, learn the important questions to ask when building a dynamic ad insertion solution for live video streaming, and how to successfully serve billions of ad impressions across a range of playback devices.

title: Optimizing Risk Analysis with Grid Computing on AWS
abstract: In this session, discover how a major multinational Insurance company has improved the performance of their risk analysis calculations while reducing their cost using Amazon EC2 Spot Instances.

title: [REPEAT 1] Architecting for Enterprise Identity Across Multiple Operating Models
abstract: A critical component of any cloud journey is ensuring that the identity architecture enables users and operators of cloud-based infrastructure to maintain or increase their level of productivity while maintaining appropriate levels of security. Such an architecture must take into account the likelihood that engineers from different organizations and differing operating models must work together to achieve outcomes. This talk explores how AWS Managed Services built such a system, leveraging industry standard components. Security experts from across multiple AWS service teams answer your questions about strategy and technical implementation.

title: Amazon Aurora Multi-Master: Scaling out Database Write Performance
abstract: In this session, learn how the Multi-Master capability of Amazon Aurora MySQL enables applications to scale out write performance and achieve continuous read/write availability. Engineering experts dive into the design concepts of Aurora Multi-Master, and provide real-world advice on deploying high-throughput, highly available workloads in Aurora.

title: [REPEAT 2] Build AWS CloudFormation Custom Resources
abstract: Custom resources enable AWS CloudFormation customers to write customized provisioning logic in templates. Such logic can be useful in changing how existing resources get created, changed, or deleted, or in including resources that are not available as supported resource types. In this session, we cover best practices, including when to use custom resources versus other programmatic alternatives. We also cover existing custom resources that are available for download and reuse.

title: [REPEAT] Securely Deploying at Scale
abstract: In this chalk talk, we discuss deploying securely at scale from source control to production using a DevSecOps model. Participants need to have prior basic knowledge of DevOps, automated deployments, and infrastructure as code (IaC). With your AWS Organization as a target, we demonstrate how to perform secured, continuous, automated, and multi-account deployments using services such as AWS Organizations, AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS CloudFormation. After this session, you gain a familiarity with DevSecOps best practices, how to ensure only compliant code gets deployed into production based on your AWS Organization, and how AWS services combined with open-source technology can help you achieve this.

title: Migrate from Oracle to Aurora PostgreSQL: Best Practices, Design Patterns, & Setup
abstract: In this session, we show you how to set the source Oracle database environment, the target PostgreSQL environment, and parameter group configuration. We also recommended database parameters to disable foreign keys and triggers. Finally, we discuss best practices for using AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) and AWS Schema Conversion Tool (AWS SCT) and show you how to choose the instance type and configure AWS DMS.

title: [REPEAT 2] Deep Dive into Three Critical Aspects of Alexa's In-Skill Purchase API
abstract: In this session, we walk through the data flow and user flow diagrams of an Alexa in-purchase skill, and we show you how to implement and debug at every stage of the flow. Walk away with an intimate understanding of how to design and implement in-skill purchasing, so you can sell digital goods to your Alexa customers.

title: Letting Your Technology Break Without Concern
abstract: It's a fact that at some point, something will break. Make sure that you are prepared. In this session, we dive deep into the requirements for a highly available and scalable architecture, and we show you how to deploy it. Achieving true availability involves a delicate balance among operations, security, development, and business. In this chalk talk, we show you where you might need to make business changes. We cover the technology you should be adopting, and we share the methodologies you should be teaching your engineers.

title: Back up and Manage On-Premises and Cloud-Native Workloads with Rubrik on AWS
abstract: Moving backups to the cloud and managing data protection across on-premises and cloud environments can be challenging. AWS Partner Network (APN) Advanced and Storage Competency Technology Partner, Rubrik, showcases its Cloud Data Management solution, and how it delivers backup, instant application availability, replication, DR, search, archival, and analytics, enabling you to lower your recovery time objective (RTO) to just minutes. In this chalk talk, Rubik shows how you can back up local data copies to Amazon S3, back up Amazon EC2 instances by deploying Rubrik software on AWS, and archive long-term data to Amazon Glacier.

title: Reducing Your Compute Footprint with AWS Fargate (Datree)
abstract: AWS Fargate makes it easy to run containers by removing the need to provision, scale, or manage servers. In this interactive session, we discuss how moving to the resource-based utilization model offered by AWS Fargate allows development and operations teams to reduce their compute footprint and optimize costs.

title: Building a Serverless Consulting Practice
abstract: The broad adoption of serverless architectures across industries and segments not only impacts our customers’ cost models and speed to market, but it also changes what they need from our partner community. In this interactive chalk talk, we discuss the patterns we observe in our most successful consulting partners who are growing their client base and expanding their influence within existing accounts using serverless approaches. Join the conversation and learn how you can apply these patterns to build your own serverless consulting practice.

title: Optimizing Healthcare Call Centers with Natural Language Understanding
abstract: Large call volumes into customer service call centers can lead to frustrated customers, delayed responses, and overburdened staff, particularly when a large number of queries could have been resolved with simple yes or no answers, or formulaic responses. In this session hear from the National Health Service (NHS) Business Services Authority, the support body for multiple NHS organizations in England, how it is using machine learning to manage the large volumes of calls coming to their call center (five million calls each year). Learn how these services have been used to reduce call response times, increase staff morale, and maximize staff utilization for value-add activities. See how to develop and implement Amazon Connect, Amazon Lex, and Amazon Polly to automate call centers, reduce labor costs, and provide a consistent experience for customers.

title: Designing an Enterprise Windows and .NET Authentication Strategy
abstract: Authentication is one of the most important parts of your IT estate to get right. In this chalk talk, we discuss the main approaches for designing an enterprise Windows and .NET authentication strategy and answer any questions you may have. This is an interactive question-and-answer session, so please bring your questions and join us for this discussion.

title: [REPEAT 1] Failing Successfully in the Cloud: AWS Approach to Resilient Design
abstract: AWS global infrastructure provides the tools customers need to design resilient and reliable services. In this session, we discuss how to get the most out of these tools.

title: Implementing Microservice Architectures with Amazon DynamoDB and AWS Lambda
abstract: In this chalk talk, we start with building blocks for reliable event delivery in microservice architectures using DynamoDB and Lambda. We then discuss how to use these building blocks to implement eventually consistent transactional behavior and support for querying using Command Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS) pattern in serverless microservices. Along the way, we discuss the tradeoffs and benefits of event-driven over request/response designs, and we go into the details of tuning DynamoDB and Lambda-based reliable delivery and processing pipelines for scale, performance, and cost.

title: [REPEAT] Bridging Message Brokers to Cloud-Native Messaging Services
abstract: Learn how to connect your JMS-based applications to the cloud and integrate them with new cloud-native applications. In this session, we quickly refresh your knowledge about messaging enterprise integration patterns. We then discuss architectural examples to bridge the JMS-based and cloud-native worlds. We work through an example implementation based on Amazon MQ, Amazon SQS, and Amazon SNS. Leave this session with a solid understanding of how to connect existing applications to new cloud-native applications using messaging patterns.

title: AWS Public Data Sets: How to Stage Petabytes of Data for Analysis in AWS
abstract: AWS hosts a variety of public data sets that anyone can access for free. Previously, large data sets such as satellite imagery or genomic data have required hours or days to locate, download, customize, and analyze. When data is made publicly available on AWS, anyone can analyze any volume of data without downloading or storing it themselves. In this session, the AWS Open Data Team shares tips and tricks, patterns and anti-patterns, and tools to help you effectively stage your data for analysis in the cloud.

title: [REPEAT 1] IoT Microcontrollers and Getting Started with Amazon FreeRTOS
abstract: Come explore the challenges of embedded development, and learn to use Amazon FreeRTOS to solve these challenges. We cover differentiated features, such as tickless mode for low power consumption and the ecosystem of tools available for development, test, and debug. We also discuss use cases and their choice of microcontroller architecture.

title: Keeping the Pace with Data Ingestion
abstract: Data is eating the world. Don't let it consume your organization! In this talk, we take a deep dive into the various methods of ingesting the ever-increasing amount of data that your organization is generating, and we discuss how to effectively leverage that data as part of your data analytics pipeline. We cover topics such as batch and real-time ingestion with AWS services and open source tools. We also dive into some reference architecture implementations of common ingestion patterns. Finally, we discuss how you can make this data useful through catalogs and governance.

title: [REPEAT 2] Everything You Wanted to Know about Developing for Voice Using Alexa
abstract: In this chalk talk, we review the common challenges developers face when building voice experiences for Alexa. We provide an overview of the history of design in technology, highlighting what we learned over the years in developing for a screen. We also establish best practices for voice-first design using the Alexa Skills Kit, which we contrast with GUI design principles. You have the opportunity to ask questions and discuss ideas among fellow skill developers. By the end of this session, expect to understand the similarities and differences between developing for voice and developing for screen-oriented mediums.

title: [REPEAT] Don’t Let SFTP Weigh Down Your Migration to the Cloud
abstract: SFTP is a file exchange protocol that is deeply embedded in many enterprise applications across industries. If you've read this far, you likely already know that and are trying to figure out how you can (more) effectively run SFTP services in front of Amazon S3, potentially so you can migrate a key application to AWS. But you can't change your applications or break your client authentication schemes. Attend this session to learn an architecture and best practices with AWS-based tools that can simplify shifting (or improving) SFTP services to the cloud.

title: [REPEAT] AWS Certificate Management and Private Certificate Authority Deep Dive
abstract: In this chalk talk, we cover the fundamentals of certificate management with AWS Certificate Manager (ACM), including new features that further simplify the validation process. We also discuss how to build and configure a private certificate authority for issuing certificates that are trusted within your organization. Finally, we walk through use cases and examples showing how customers use certificates to automate authentication and secure communications.

title: Integrate Amazon WorkDocs with Security & Compliance Solutions & Applications
abstract: File collaboration and management services don’t exist in a vacuum. They need to work well with other applications. The Amazon WorkDocs SDK enables you to use file collaboration and management capabilities with your existing compliance solutions and end-user applications by providing full administrator and user-level access to Amazon WorkDocs site resources. In this chalk talk, we describe how to use Amazon WorkDocs to integrate with your compliance solutions and end-user applications

title: [REPEAT 1] Instrumenting Applications for Observability Using AWS X-Ray
abstract: AWS X-Ray enables developers to gain visibility into distributed applications as if they were running on your developer desktop. Come learn how you can instrument your applications to make use of X-Ray and reduce the time it takes to resolve issues and errors in both development and production environments from hours to minutes.

title: Best Practices for Designing GraphQL APIs That Scale
abstract: The emergence of GraphQL over the past couple of years has changed the way people are thinking about API development and is reshaping the way engineering teams are structured by allowing front-end developers to move further up the stack and redefining traditional engineering roles. With the introduction of AWS AppSync, we can easily extend the possibilities of what GraphL is capable of, enabling a single GraphQL API to power entire applications by working with multiple data sources, microservices, and AWS Lambda functions. In this session, we show this architecture in action, walk through the design and implementation, and answer your questions as we dive deep.

title: Security in Amazon Elasticsearch Service
abstract: Amazon Elasticsearch Service has a rich set of security features that give you control over access to data in your domain. Whether you're using Amazon Cognito to integrate with your federated identity provider for a Kibana login, building a VPC application and integrating search, or using IAM for fine-grained access, you need to understand your options so you can keep your data safe. Leave this session with a practical set of tools for security.

title: Building a Messaging Application with Redis Streams
abstract: Redis Streams is a new data type introduced in Redis 5.0 for message publishing and subscription. It differs from existing pub/sub components as it provides message persistence and primary/secondary data replication. Attend this session to learn about Redis Streams and discover how you can use it to build better messaging applications, such as chat, queues, and IoT.

title: Optimizing Your SaaS Architecture on AWS
abstract: So you've built your SaaS application and now you're wondering what's next. What opportunities should I be thinking about in terms of maximizing the performance, cost, and scalability of my solution? How can I ensure that my multi-tenant storage model will scale? What should I be doing to ensure that one tenant can’t overload the system? These are among the many challenges and questions that SaaS architects face as they look at how to evolve their SaaS solutions and better align their architecture with the evolving needs of the business. In this chalk talk, targeted at those already deep in the weeds of SaaS, we explore strategies and patterns that being applied to optimize the performance of SaaS solutions on AWS.

title: Best Practices for Container Image Management
abstract: Container registries like Amazon ECR make it easy to store and distribute container images. In this session, we cover best practices for managing container images in both shared and private repositories. We also discuss proper version control for easy rollbacks, repository organization, how to implement lifecycle policies, and distributing images to multiple operating systems and locations.

title: [REPEAT 1] How ThingLogix Redefined the Conference Experience for VMworld Attendees
abstract: Virtual reality (VR) is redefining how companies engage with customers and present their products and services. In this session, experts from AWS and leaders from ThingLogix provide a technical deep dive on an innovative VR experience created for VMware. The VR-based experience provides a new, immersive way to learn about VMmare Cloud services while also providing a real-time demonstration of how Amazon Sumerian integrates with Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, and AWS IoT services. Attendees learn how to replicate this experience across use cases and industries to create powerful ways to convey information and engage audiences.

title: [REPEAT 2] Improve your Security Posture with AWS CloudFormation
abstract: There are many ways to improve your security controls in AWS accounts. In this session, we'll cover how to leverage guidelines from the Center of Internet Security (CIS), how to augment security checks, and how to build and secure AWS resources with additional tools.  Armed with the information in this session,  you will be able to harden new AWS accounts and implement security best practices from Day One.

title: Deep Dive into New AWS IoT Services Launched in 2018
abstract: Take a deep dive into the newer services available in 2018 for AWS IoT. In this session, we look at new features added to AWS IoT Core and AWS Greengrass with Edge ML, and then deep dive into AWS IoT Analytics, AWS Device Management, and AWS IoT Device Defender. Learn more about when to use some of these services and explore comparisons between them.

title: [REPEAT 1] Serverless Anti-Patterns to Avoid
abstract: With cloud computing ushering in an era of agility and scalability, it’s also served as a catalyst, helping computing evolve from the physical and virtual servers of on premises to more flexible paradigms, including containers and more recently, serverless computing. Built on the same programming languages and tools used for traditional application architectures, serverless allows organizations to leverage their existing development skills, but like all new approaches, it also brings challenges. While traditional design approaches still apply to serverless, it’s easy to fall prey to serverless anti-patterns, including tight coupling, anemic monitoring, and monolithic coding. In this session, ex explore common serverless anti-patterns, and how to avoid them or right-design them with AWS Lambda and other related services.

title: Breaking up the Monolith
abstract: Legacy applications are everywhere. When should you begin to refactor to a microservices approach, and what are the best ways to approach this challenge? In this chalk talk, we walk through a real-world example of breaking up a monolith.

title: Go Global with Cloud-Native Architecture: Deploy AdTech Services Across Four Continents
abstract: Plista, a Germany-based advertising solution provider, discusses how they use a cloud-native architecture, container-first approach to speed up development, increase agility, reduce latency, localize storage, and foster innovation and ownership in their organization. They demonstrate how a cloud blueprint is used to easily roll out their services to new global markets. With this architecture, Plista processes 1.7 billion requests per day, across four continents. They also discuss how they're adapting for GDPR compliance and redesigning parts of their platform to leverage new AWS services.

title: [REPEAT] Using Enterprise Support to Optimize and Secure Your AWS Environment
abstract: Companies expecting speed and agility from cloud computing can find knowledge gaps that lead to slow and costly processes. AWS Enterprise Support can help customers with faster value realization, reduced risks, and higher quality deployments. In this session, hear from an AWS technology account manager and selected customers about how AWS Enterprise Support has helped in unexpected ways to give customers access to AWS service teams to drive roadmaps, proactively optimize the performance of AWS services, maintain and improve security, and optimize costs. Learn how to best engage with AWS Enterprise Support to achieve your outcomes and do amazing things with AWS.

title: [REPEAT] Enterprise Strategies and Best Practices for Migrating Your Contact Center to Amazon
abstract: Join us for a session where we walk you through our migration framework and best practices for moving your enterprise contact center to Amazon Connect. We discuss how to take advantage of agile and phased approaches to address administration, regulatory requirements, data gathering, and infrastructure needs (WAN, Direct Connect / MPLS, etc.). We then do a deep dive on specific topics, such as contact center locations, compliance, security, and reporting. By the end of this session, you will understand how to combine Amazon Connect with other AWS services to fit the needs of customers for global utilization.

title: [REPEAT 1] Best Practices for CI/CD with AWS Lambda and Amazon API Gateway
abstract: Building and deploying serverless applications introduces new challenges for developers whose development workflows are optimized for traditional VM-based applications. In this session, we discuss a method for automating the deployment of serverless applications running on AWS Lambda. First, we cover how you can model and express serverless applications using the open source AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM). Then, we discuss how you can use CI/CD tooling from AWS CodePipeline and AWS CodeBuild, and how to bootstrap the entire toolset using AWS CodeStar. We also cover best practices to embed in your deployment workflow specific to serverless applications.

title: [REPEAT 1] Infrastructure as Code: AWS Best Practices
abstract: When you consider your DevOps practice, infrastructure as code (IaC) is invaluable.
